Reviews.Title: “Impressed with service”
Reviews.Author: Lucas G
Reviews.Content: Our last trip to Toronto landed us at the Primrose Best Western in downtown Toronto after finding a good deal online. We were pleased with the hotel in general and found the room to be quite inviting. We were given a room with 2 beds on the 19th floor. It was clean, and the furniture looked to be newer. What impressed me most though was the service I received from everyone at the hotel. We had an unfortunate incident with the toilet which clogged after my young son accidently flushed his toothbrush down the toilet and not only did the woman at the desk send someone up immediately to fix it, they also sent up a replacement toothbrush for my son. It was a welcome surprise and I would like to pass on my thanks to her (sorry, don’t remember her name). Everyone was very friendly and made us feel welcome and more importantly, understood the toilet issue was an accident and didn’t try to make us feel bad for causing problems. Service made the difference and will make us return again on our next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to being a downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffS_Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night in January. A getaway of sorts. The room was small, not that clean and certainly in need of updating. For a central, downtown hotel we were expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Matilda K
Reviews.Content: My husband had a meeting in the city and we were planning on continuing on to Ottawa the next day for more meetings but as it ran late, we decided to stay in Toronto as we lost the last plane to Ottawa. We didn’t have a reservation anywhere, but the Primrose Hotel was the closest hotel and so we were able to get a room without at reservation. We really didn’t need much other than a place that was close to a restaurant and internet access, both of which they had (internet was free too unlike other places I have been to). The room was clean and comfortable. No problems with check out and overall found it to be a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zaneta M
Reviews.Content: My firm booked me into the Primrose Hotel for a conference I had to attend in the city. I was pleased with service of the hotel and appreciated the free internet connection. The hotel was very nice, and looks like they are doing renovations. I thought the hotel was in a good location and I found it was easy to walk to restaurants at night. The Tim Hortons in the lobby was also convenient for a late night coffee. All in all, I had a good stay and would recommend this hotel to others looking for good service, clean rooms and reasonable room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel undergoing refurb”
Reviews.Author: Travellian
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located fairly close to the centre of Toronto. We arrived to find the Hotel underging a refurbishment,which we were not advised of at the time of booking or through the Hotel website. We we awoken with the sound of drills and banging which was not good. We complained and was moved to a room a few floors below,that had already been refurbed. I do not understand why the hotel website did not advise of the works,and the management didnt seem to have an answer either. The Hotel was half full with students. Which although a little unusual did not cause us any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Edward L
Reviews.Content: We decided to surprise our kids and took them to Toronto for a few days for some family time last Christmas holidays. We booked a room online at the Primrose Hotel as we are familiar with the brand and the standards they adhere to. We had an absolutely fabulous time. The hotel is in a great location and we were close to the CN Tower, the museum and the Hockey Hall of Fame. The only attraction we had to drive to was the Science Centre, but it was only about 20 minutes from downtown, and the front desk lady was nice enough to give us a map and write out the driving instructions for us so we made it without getting lost. The room was perfect for us, and had 2 queen beds and a great view of the lake (we were on the 20th floor). It also had kids movies which was great for calming the kids down at the end of the day. There were lots of restaurants around, and found the area and city in general to be very family friendly. It was a great mini vacation and something we plan to do again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Kiran M
Reviews.Content: I recently had to stay in Toronto for business and due to a conference going on, the Primrose Hotel was the only one I could find that had rooms that werenâ€™t over $400 a night. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel itself and felt it was worth the money. The location was great and it only took me a few minutes to walk to the subway station. The staff were very friendly and it was evident they took pride in their job. The hotel itself seems to be undergoing renovations, but I was not disturbed by noise of any kind. The rooms are great. I have never stayed here before, so not sure if I was in a newly done room or not, but I found the room to be large, clean and the furniture looked new (which lead me to believe I may have been in a new room). The only complaint I had was that the bathroom fan is hooked into the light, so usually I like to sleep with the bathroom light on, but had to have it off so as not to leave the fan running. Apart from that small detail, I was happy with my stay and would have no issues staying there again if I return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Rooms All Good”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: Our church group recently stayed at the Primrose Hotel. We had chosen this hotel as it was downtown and they were able to give us a discounted group rate as we had 17 rooms in total. Everything went very smoothly. All the guests were checked- in in advance so no one had to line up at the front desk. The doorman assisted everyone with their luggage and picked it up when we left and brought it to the bus. The group in general was pleased with the rooms. We had a mixture of rooms with 1 bed and some with 2 beds. The service was great and we had a breakfast arranged in a private dining room which everyone enjoyed. I was pleased with the service I received from the staff both when arranging the tour and during the stay. We plan to make this an annual trip and will check back first with the Primrose before looking elsewhere for rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Jana V
Reviews.Content: Booked a room through Hotwire and was given the Primrose Hotel. Was happy with the location and found I was able to get around quite easily as the subway station was only a few minutes walk away. Overall I was happy with the hotel. Hereâ€™s my quick breakdown. Pros â€“ staff really friendly, location good â€“ lots to do around and places to eat, rooms clean, large and well decorated. Cons â€“ restaurant doesnâ€™t open for breakfast until 7am, and so unable to eat as I had to leave by 6am, no laundry machines on site, had to send out laundry which was a bit more expensive than coin operated machines usually are (although I did get it back that evening). Was happy with the stay overall, and would stay again if back in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: suek219
Reviews.Content: A great Surprise,,, The hotel & rooms are undergoing a face lift. Lobby looks great and rooms are nice. The hotel is in a good location and close to everything by walking or a short cab ride. The breakfast in the dining room is worth every penny. Having a Tim Hortons Just off the Lobby is a great perk for the person on a tight schedule. Will Visit again, Thanks for your Hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a lovely week between Toronto and Montreal and were pleased with our hotels. We spent the first 4 days in Toronto and reserved at the Primrose Hotel. We were happy with the location as we were able to walk to many places. There was a great little restaurant within walking distance which I believe was called The Honey Pot or something like that. Very quaint and charming and a definite place to visit for dinner. The staff was friendly and assisted us with our requests for more coffee and face cloths. The room was also quite lovely, although we did have a small issue with our room key, but it was quickly fixed and soon forgotten. We enjoyed our time in the city, and saw many wonderful places including a tour of the Art Gallery which is another definite must see. Toronto is such a wonderful city, and we hope to return again as we werenâ€™t able to see all we wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased Overall”
Reviews.Author: Laura K
Reviews.Content: Found a good deal online at the Primrose Hotel so decided to book there. The rooms were large, clean and nicely decorated. The location is close to shopping and restaurants. The staff are friendly and helpful. Considering what I paid online, I thought it was a good deal. No issues with my stay. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A well positioned budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthKarmon
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because our daughter was staying in the student accommodation here as well. It's only a two and a half star hotel so you can't expect all the luxuries of a 4 or 5 star and as a result it was well priced. The room had 2 double beds and was reasonably spacious. No fridge or electric jug but I think that is normal for a standard room in any hotel in North America. The beds were comfortable and the sheets good quality but the furniture is pretty dated and the bathroom very tired looking. It did have nice white towels and a good selection of toiletries. A four cup coffee maker and supplies and complementary wi-fi were useful. Â The carpet wasn't as well vacuumed as one would expect with the corners and edges not done for a while. The window looking at a fantastic view north was so grimy it was hard to see through (finger and nose prints all over it) We just kept the net curtains closed so we couldn't see them and enjoyed the night lights instead. We didn't complain as we had already made ourselves at home & strewn all our belongings around the room and it would have been a bother to move. The location is good being a short walk into town and is close to the new Loblaws food emporium at Maple Leaf Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Brett M
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here as part of a city break package, while visiting friends in the Toronto area. On checking in, I found that my reservation had been cancelled as my flight had been delayed for 24 hrs due to bad weather in Amsterdam. An annoyance rather than trouble really. I`m glad I didn`t have a car, as the parking charges were horrendous. The staff were very friendly & efficient, & sorted the booking problem immediately. I was surprised to find that the area itself was a bit seedy. There were several `ladies of indeterminate occupation` on duty outside the front door most of the day & night. However, they were very pleasant & always said hello whenever I passed! The room was a pleasant surprise, considering it was a budget hotel. Big, clean, with 2 large double beds. The view was great. I`ve never been on the 18th floor of anywhere before. Considering that a lot of rooms are let out to students, it was pretty quiet. My mate came into town on my last night & there was no extra charge for the room share, which was cool. The only gripe I had really, was that the bar shut very early & we couldn`t get a beer when we returned after our night on the town. The `Tim Horton`s` coffee shop in the reception was a bonus. great coffee & doughnuts in the mornings! The general location was very close to the downtown area. great for shopping, dining & partying. I was surprised to find what amounted to an underground shopping city that stretched all the way down to the waterfront. If I was going back, I`d definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Time”
Reviews.Author: Bryan M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently took a trip to Toronto for our 35th wedding anniversary and booked in at the Primrose Hotel. It was close to the theatre we were going to and the price was affordable. We were extremely impressed with both the hotel and the service. We mentioned on check in that it was our anniversary and were immediately upgraded from our room with 1 double to a king room on the highest floor with a wonderful view of the city. They were also kind enough to recommend and make reservations at a lovely restaurant called Ruth Chris (pricey but well worth it if you are a steak lover). The hotel was in a great location and we walked to a charming area called Yorkville. The room itself was very spacious and clean. I saw some work being done in the lobby and wonder if they also did the rooms as our furniture looked to be new and had no damage or wear you normally see. The only issue I did not like was that the fan in the bathroom automatically turns on when you turn on the light, and usually my wife likes to sleep with the bathroom light on, but we didnâ€™t as the fan would be running. Other than that, we were most pleased with the hotel and hope to return again on our 40th.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumSince02
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly and accomadating. Vicky at the front desk was very nice and made us feel welcome. The hotel is situated in a good area and walking distance to Eaton Centre and many other attractions. We were there for a Chicago concert at Massey Hall and it was about a ten minute walk. We also experienced the subway and found it was very easy to get around. Over all our hotel was clean and we had a newly renovated room. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location Great”
Reviews.Author: Liza M
Reviews.Content: My friends and I got 2 rooms at the Primrose hotel as we were going to a concert at the Phoenix and they were within walking distance. We were happy that they were able to give us adjoining rooms which made getting ready so much easier. The hotel is in a good location and there is a great Irish pub about a block away that we went to after the show. Staff were really good and let us check out at noon instead of the normal time. Only problem was they werenâ€™t able to give us our rooms when we arrived a few hours before check in, and said that although they had rooms they didnâ€™t have any adjoining ones available. They were able to store our bags though until they were ready and we only had to wait about 45minutes so I guess technically it was still an early check in. Also, got asked by a security guard when we came back after the concert for our room key or else they wouldnâ€™t let us get on the elevator. We had a great time though, and hope to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: sbrinka v
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Toronto and were booked into the Primrose Hotel via Hotwire. We are familiar with the Best Western name, so expected a certain standard and were pleased that they were above what we were expecting. The hotel is obviously undergoing renovations, and we were lucky to get one of the newly done rooms (in fact we were told by the girl at check in that we were the first people to stay in the room as it was just completed that morning). We were very impressed and although we donâ€™t know what the room looked like before, it was evident that the furniture was all brand new as there were no wear marks or stains on anything. Even the bathroom looked like they were done also as everything was spotless. We were extremely impressed and would definitely recommend people go here, but make sure to ask for one of the new rooms. Well worth the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Sales Staff Were Great”
Reviews.Author: Brittany B
Reviews.Content: I used the sales department at the hotel to make a booking for a block of rooms coming to Toronto for a family wedding. I was very pleased with the arrangements made, and since we werenâ€™t exactly sure how many rooms we needed, the hotel allowed us to reserve 15 rooms, and provided we told them a few weeks in advance, didnâ€™t charge us for the rooms which we didnâ€™t need. They were also able to give us rooms all on the same floor which made things much easier to get ready on the morning of the wedding. We ended up with 12 rooms in total and no one in our group had any problems or complaints. I guess the only thing I didnâ€™t really like was the cost of the parking which was $23 a day, but I guess after paying close to $40 for valet parking at the wedding venue and hearing that someone else at the wedding paid almost $30 for parking at their hotel, I canâ€™t really complain since it looks like Toronto in general is expensive for parking. We all really enjoyed our stay, and hope that sometime in the future, we will be able to return to Toronto and explore the city more since we really didnâ€™t get much time to look around.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Marcia F
Reviews.Content: Had to go to Toronto for a series of training seminars which were being held at the Convention Centre. Had planned to stay at the Royal York since it was across the street, but ended up at the Primrose Hotel since the rate was about $60 cheaper a night. Even with the $20 round trip taxi ride to the meeting and back I still saved money. My other reason for choosing this hotel was the fact that they have free wireless internet access which was much needed. The room itself was very nice and quite large by normal hotel standards. The staff were friendly and helpful in arranging my daily taxis to the convention centre. An added convenience is a Tim Hortonâ€™s in the lobby which opens an hour earlier than their restaurant. I was pleased with my stay overall and would have no reservations in staying again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Derek S
Reviews.Content: So we went to Toronto for some girl time and had a fantabulous time. We got 2 rooms at the Primrose Hotel as they were able to give us rooms with a connecting door. We spent the whole weekend shopping, clubbing and eating. The hotel was totally cool. The people who work there are great and seem to know all the cool places to hang out at. The room was wickedly huge and we had tons of space. The maid lady was also super nice and gave us extras of everything like towels, shampoo and soaps and stuff. Was an amazing time and absolutely LOVE Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All”
Reviews.Author: Felizia W
Reviews.Content: After much searching for a decent hotel at a cheap rate in downtown Toronto, we finally settled on the Primrose Hotel. From the map it looked like it was pretty much in the middle of the downtown area and the rate was cheaper than some of the other hotels. I guess in general we were pleased with the stay. The rooms were large and clean which was all we really needed. They had a restaurant but we didnâ€™t use it and opted for a quick coffee and muffin at the coffee shop beside the lobby. The staff were nice and helpful. We didnâ€™t run into any problems at the hotel, but unfortunately our trip ended on a sour note as my wifeâ€™s wallet was pickpocketed while we were outside the CN Tower. A tip to all travelers â€“ doesnâ€™t matter where you go or where you stay, there are people out there who are thieves..any traveling we will do now will ensure that our valuables are left in the hotel safe and we wear a money belt. I am thankful however to the manager of the hotel, who when he heard our plight, assisted us with contacting the local police and filing a report.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK”
Reviews.Author: kjenni20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the best western for a weekend out with friends. The room was large which was a positive and our view was awesome of the city. The room could have been more clean and the price was decent. OK experience.

Reviews.Title: “Price Paid was Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Alice D
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with my recent trip to Toronto. Our family was enroute to visit family for the holidays and decided to spend a few days in Toronto to take the kids up the CN Tower and the Hockey Hall of Fame. We choose the Primrose based on the rate and the location as we were only a few minutes walk to the subway which we took to the CN Tower. We were given a nice room on the 22nd floor which had 2 beds in the room. The staff were nice enough to provide a small fridge for us to keep some snacks for the kids. The room was clean which is my main judging point in any hotel, and was large enough that we werenâ€™t bumping into each other. In my opinion, the hotel was priced right and we were glad to save some money as it cost us over $120.00 for a family of 4 to go up the tower. (hereâ€™s a tip â€“ look for discount coupons for attractions online as a family of 4 to go up the tower and to the hockey hall of fame cost over $200 â€“ I guess no one said Toronto was a cheap city.)

Reviews.Title: “MANY ISSUES WITH LITTLE RESPONSE”
Reviews.Author: mushkiki
Reviews.Content: #1) Business Centre: no paper in printer, no pens, no envelopes, wi-fi slow and potentially virused #2) Several of the desk staff were cold and flat in their behaviour. One front desk was outright rude and unhelpful for several requests which had to be handled by a morning person who was confused why the evening staff wouldn't help me until I told her the staff name and she rolled her eyes and suggested I speak with management. Director of Operations heard my complaints @ check-out but I did not feel acknowledged. Even after survey completion I did not hear back from them. #3) Sauna listed as an immenity. Don't bother walking down to that. Go in your clothes because it never heats up and this was in the winter. #4) Gave me coupons for the free continental breakfast. 1st time I have ever witnessed that. This gives me concerns as they do not know who their guests are and who isn't. #5) A dead give away that there would be issues is the sign on the building towering over the city is half burnt out. Upkeep issues alarm is sounding and the red flags start coming out. Not of Best western quality. #6) they love running the vacuum cleaner by your room with a quiet sign up before 9:00 am.#7) They own the parking and they ding you for that extra as well and it is in their very own basement. #8) Prostitution active within two block radius Positives: The guys on consierge are kind and most helpful and were the saving grace of this hotel. One even apologized for the front desk staff's negative behaviour over the 3 night's stay. Either of these two gentlemen should be the manager. surrounded by great restauants and a healthy walking distance to shops, Air Canada Centre, CN Tower. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sasha P
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto to celebrate the big 3-0 with some friends and found a room online at the Primrose Hotel. This was my first trip to Toronto so didnâ€™t know what to expect or where anything was. The lady at the front desk was amazing and not only gave me free maps, but also spent a lot of time giving us tips on where the best clubs / bars etc were and even told us how to get on list so we didnâ€™t have to wait in line. The room we had was on the 20th floor and had 2 huge bedsâ€¦..definitely not a standard double bed I am used to in hotel rooms. Room was clean and the lady who cleaned the room was nice enough to give us triple the towels in the room. My suggestion for the hotel though is try to get a room away from the elevator. We were beside the elevator and at one point someone in the elevator kept hitting the alarm button and we could hear it. Weekend was a blast and I LOVE Toronto and cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for a Layover”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: Had a stop over for the night in Toronto and instead of staying at the airport where there is nothing to do, decided to go downtown and look around. Got a room without a reservation at the Primrose Hotel which was right beside an underground train stop. The price was good and they had a room with a king bed open. The place was in a good location and I was able to walk to a huge mall and what I guess is Torontoâ€™s equivalent of Times Square. There was a great Thai restaurant too called Jasmine Gardenâ€™s if anyone out there is into Thai food. Staff was friendly and room was good. Large for downtown (what I would call a suite if I was staying in NYC). There is also a coffee shop in the lobby which was open late so that was convenient. Was able to get a taxi back to the airport the next morning no problem. Would like to spend more time in the city, and when I do decide to go back would check back with hotel to see if they have rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a look on a budget”
Reviews.Author: DarrenCBristol
Reviews.Content: I needed somewhere to stay downtown for a week and didn't want to pay a fortune. This hotel was a nice surprise for the price. Big comfortable rooms, very clean although a little bit tired but no complaints given the price. Service was good from the staff and there were some very good local options for breakfast or a drink in the evening. The location seemed to be a bit more off the main streets than a previous more upmarket hotel i stayed in and it was a bit quieter if walking back to the hotel late at night, but i never saw any trouble or had any hassle or issues. Definatley worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget choice downtown”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Great budget choice downtown in a very pricey city. Accomodations basic. Rooms ok. Near the new Loblaws grocery superstore-great retail entertainment. Also near subway. Get a room facing away from Carlton to avoid the street noise. Room needed vacuming-which was taken care of immediately. AAA rate a steal. Not the Ritz but save your money for the salmon at the food court at the near by Loblaws (which also has a coffee bar which also has great gelato).

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service â€“ 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Toronto to meet up with some friends and got a room for cheap at the Primrose hotel. The location was good, right where I needed to be, and the price was great for downtown and I only paid $89 with a corporate discount. The staff were great, and let me check in early (and I mean early as in 10:30am!!!). I was given a room on the 3rd floor since I donâ€™t like elevators very much and it was easy to use the stairs to get to the room. It was a decent sized room and had a desk and a couch in it. It was clean and comfortable. Wouldnâ€™t hesitate to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “great price, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Judith C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Primrose hotel a few times. I continue to go back because the room is clean, beds are comfortable, location and the rooms are sufficient size. It is also good bang for your buck. The location is not too bad, walking distance to downtown and very close to Maple Leaf Gardens, which recently opened as a grocery store/ market, which is fantastic, a must see. The staff is really good at this hotel anytime there is a problem they are there immediately to fix it. The hotel is a little tired and so are the rooms but the beds are comfortable and rooms are clean. Nothing fancy, but I do like duvets which they have. I have stayed at many hotels over the years and if the staff and beds are good, I'm happy. The one thing I learned on the last trip is some of the floors are temporary dorms for University student. So don't be surprised if you see a lot of university aged people. It did not cause any problems for us, including no problem with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: Perico W
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a weekend spa getaway with the girls. We had a spa day arranged at Elmwood Spa, and decided to save some money and stay at the Primrose Hotel. Was happy with the hotel overall. The location was good and since it was still fairly warm outside, we were able to walk to the spa. There are lots of shops along the way, so it was a nice walk. The rooms were great. Very clean, and we all got a good nightâ€™s sleep. We didnâ€™t have any major issues when there which werenâ€™t dealt with promptly and to our satisfaction (apparently a movie which we did not order appeared on our bill, but the manager quickly took it off without a hassle). It was a fantastic weekend, I highly recommend the spa and the hotel is perfect place to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, we liked it.”
Reviews.Author: JustinH
Reviews.Content: Played Hotwire roulette and thought that we lost when we were assigned to the Best Western. This hotel was not bad at all, check-in was very quick. The man at the desk even helped us plan out a walk to the Hockey Hall of Fame. Very helpful at the front desk. We were assigned two double beds and told that a King was not available. This is sometimes how hotwire works, so we understand that. The room was very clean and well appointed. Free internet access worked fine, but not fast. Parking was 23 dollars per night, and it was a bit of a fiasco to even get back into the secure lot to get the car back. We needed a special hotel key for the parking lot elevator, the one we were given for the elevator did not work, so we had to ask the front desk. The only thing I did not like about this property is the lack of a indoor swimming pool or even a hot tub. Every other hotel in the area in this class level has one. The best western has a seasonal outdoor pool only, which is no good in December.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet for Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: danna s
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only and due to a delayed flight, didnâ€™t check in until after midnight. We were happy that they still had the room reserved for us and had our keys ready so we didnâ€™t have to wait. We werenâ€™t in the room very long, and pretty much went to bed as soon as we got there. The bed was super comfortable I think I fell asleep instantly. I am a light sleeper and since I slept through the night, the hotel must have been quiet as usually the slightest noise wakes me us. Staff were great the next morning, and after a coffee we were on our way. I do hope to return to Toronto to spend a little more time exploring the city, and if we come back would have no issues booking at the Primrose again.

Reviews.Title: “Went in with no expectations and was pleased”
Reviews.Author: Dimitri F
Reviews.Content: I went to Toronto for a friendâ€™s wedding and booked a package flight / hotel online and got the Primrose Hotel. I didnâ€™t know anything about the hotel so had no real expectations as to what I would find. When I arrived the staff were great and very professional. The front desk clerk (Jasmine I think), even went so far as to print our driving directions to the church and reception hall. The room was great, had an iron and board which was needed after having cloths packed in a bag for a while. It was clean, and quiet, and I must say they do take security seriously since they had a guard posted in the lobby when I returned at 2am. Check out was just as painless and a cab was waiting for me to take me back to Pearson Airport. It was a great stay and would choose this hotel again if I go back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: geegeeOttawa
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but are nicely furnished. The hotel has been well maintained. We had an amazing view of downtown Toronto from the 22nd floor. Staff were very accommodating and let us check in before noon (which rarely happens). Beds were quite comfortable. Just a short walk to the subway and major attractions. The breakfast buffet is OK but next time I would opt for Tim Horton's just off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Spend a Night”
Reviews.Author: Fabian M
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a night in Toronto to do some shopping and stayed overnight at the Primrose Hotel after finding a good price online. Was happy with the hotel overall. The room was good and had a nice view. The location was perfect as I walked to the Eaton Centre which was about 10 minutes away, and then the cab ride back only cost $8 including a tip. Staff were nice, and the bellman (Carlo I believe??) helped me carry my shopping up to my room. Was a good night, and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference was a Success”
Reviews.Author: Chinny W
Reviews.Content: My company recently booked a training session at the Primrose Hotel in Toronto. We were very pleased with the service and the meeting space. We occupied the Starlight room on the 23rd floor and found the room to be ideal for our training sessions. Because of the windows we were able to have natural light which helped keep people alert and didnâ€™t feel like we were stuck in a closed off room all day. We did order food and beverage and were pleased with the variety of choices available for lunches. The food was good and arrived on time and hot. The service was excellent and the session went without a hitch. Several of the attendees also stayed at the hotel and were able to get a discounted rate as part of the session. Overall our event went well and we do plan to hold our next meeting in the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value.”
Reviews.Author: aagha
Reviews.Content: Checked in early and a King room was not ready yet. Was offered a double (no thanks!) and waited about 10 min until our room was ready. Clean accomodations, location was less than 10 minute walk to subway station. Across the street from the old Maple Leaf Gardens, and it looks like a new grocery store is about to open up there soon. Tim Hortons right in the lobby which was very convenient. It appears this hotel also serves as a university residence, but there was no noise issue with that. My only real complaint is that the elevators were very slow and the computers in the business centre were slow as well. Also disappointed that pool was only outdoor/seasonal. However, sauna looked nice and clean although did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Clean and Safe”
Reviews.Author: Anna H
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a weekend getaway and found a good deal online for the Primrose Hotel. Was really happy with everything. It is a decent hotel which offers the basic amenities you find everywhere else. Room was clean and more importantly quiet. Staff were nice and helpful with dinner suggestions. Most importantly as a single female traveling alone, I have to say that I felt safe at the hotel. While the security guard in the lobby at night seemed a bit over the top at first, it just goes to show that they do take the safety of guests seriously. I had no issues or concerns during my stay, and if I was able to get a good deal again, I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “BEG BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: nemagaiq
Reviews.Content: AVOID this hotel. The two beds were totally infested with bed bugs. But the worst part is that when I complained to the manager to ask for a full refund, he says they sent a company to check the room for bugs and that "nothing was found". I am however 100% POSITIVE that we got bitten at THIS hotel, for the itching and the bits started after the first night, and we didn't stay in any other hotel in the last few weeks. So Im very doubtful of the "quality" of the inspection done in the room. I should add that the ventilation fan in the bathroom was very noisy, which made being in the bathroom unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Gregory G
Reviews.Content: Toronto is a stopover for me and I usually stay out by the airport Best Western when I need to overnight.Â  This time I stayed at the downtown Best Western and was impressed.Â  I've never seen a Best Western this big before, and didn't even know they had them.Â  Arrived around 9pm and was happy to find the restaurant open - food and service was great (Missy the waitress is awesome!)Â  Room was really nice and the bed was amazing.Â  One thing I love about Canada is Tim Hortons and they have one in the lobby!Â  Got a morning coffee and used their business office which was much better than the typical desk in the lobby with older computer that most Best Western's have, they had really machines and printer in there.Â  Concierge lined me up with a nice limo back to the airport.Â  Great hotel, good location, really nice staff.Â  This will be my new Toronto stopover.Â

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: adventure1111111
Reviews.Content: They did not allow us to use the laundry because we were not students (no sense to me). I request early check in and they said we had to pay extra day rate. hair bath front desk staff unhappy and helpless. I would never step into that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Making a Change..”
Reviews.Author: N0rthCar0linaTravel
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Toronto, I typically stay at the Courtyard Hotel. I have always found the hotel to be a decent place to stay close to most things I require. This past trip to Toronto the Courtyard was soldout so my assistant booked me into the Primrose instead The rooms are pretty much the same in terms amenities however the size of the rooms @ Primrose were much larger then the Courtyard. (I stayed in a room with 1 king bed,). The staff was very in tune with my needs unlike where I usually stay and I received a rate for my stay that was much better then my usual rate? I really could'nt see a difference between the two properties?. My only complaint is that I do like my coffee in the morning, and the Tim Hortonâ€™s in the lobby was always busy regardless of what time I went. Thankfully the line moves fast, so the extra few minutes really isnâ€™t that much of a pain. I will continue returning to the Primrose when in the city as for the Courtyard I'm taking a little break. THN

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service!”
Reviews.Author: GirlOntheg0g0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a wedding block that had been pre arranged with the hotel. Was given a room with 1 king bed and a great view of the city (was on the 19th floor). Was very happy with everything overall. The room was clean and pretty big for what I am used to in a hotel. The staff at the place were absolutely fantastic. We had a small issue with our hairdryer as I think we had too many things plugged in and may have blown a fuse, and within a few minutes of calling someone from maintenance was there to fix the problem. Everyone we met was always smiling and greeted us warmly. It was a nice added touch. There was a restaurant on site, but we didnâ€™t use it, but we did frequent the Tim Hortonâ€™s they have in the lobby. Our stay was great and we will definitely return when we next go to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Stay was painless”
Reviews.Author: Ferdinand S
Reviews.Content: Never seem to have luck when traveling with the kids at hotels. Usually there is some issue which leads to either screaming kids or hassles during the stay. Last weekendâ€™s trip to Toronto seemed to have broken my run of bad luck. We booked in at the Primrose Best Western Hotel after finding a decent rate online. The check in process was quick which was appreciated when the kids were tired and cranky from driving. The room was great and large with 2 queen beds. While the room didnâ€™t have a fridge in it which I thought was pretty standard for a hotel, they did send one up for us and install it so we could store some stuff for the kids. Our time there was good and we didnâ€™t run into any problems which was a first for us!. Was a good trip, especially our visit to the Hockey Hall of Fame (definitely the place to go if you have sons who live and breathe hockey) and the staff were great. Gets my vote for the next trip we take to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “I slept like a baby”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: I rested very well in this hotel after a long trip around USA and Canada for several meetings I had due to work in both countries. When I arrived to the Best Western, which was recommended to me by the people I had to meet, I slept like a baby. I was exhausted! Beds where big and very confortable, the sheets where clean and smell like at home. My budget was tight, but I felt like in a 4 stars due to the friendly staff. To have restaurants and shops so close to the hotel, also was very convenient, as there was no need to get a taxis to have a nice dinner out of the hotel. I say is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: Suliman A
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a buyers show and stayed at this Primrose Hotel because there was a dinner function there for us.Â  Booked on bestwestern.com as I found the rate was pretty much the same on all the websites I checked.Â  Lobby was ok, nothing too fancy.Â  I was checked in by the manager who seemed very nice and told me he upgraded my room - thanks!Â  Room was HUGE!Â  Great view of the city, very comfortable bed, I slept well.Â  Bathroom was ok, kinda like the lobby.Â  All the staff were very friendly and the breakfast buffet was good but overpriced compared to the Golden Greek restaurant next door that I found on my next morning.Â  For the price I paid I would stay again. Â Â Â

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and free Internet”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: My latest trip to Toronto my office booked me into the primrose hotel which was close to the meeting I had to attend. I was pleased with the hotel in general and it had all the amenities I needed. The staff were pleasant and assisted in getting taxis for me when needed. Only small issue was when I went to iron my pants the iron was broken. It was quickley rectified and someone brought me a new iron within minuets. The two main things I did apprieciate was, the free wireless internet, and the fact there was a Tim hortons right in the lobby. Many places I visit charge ridicules rates for internet so the fact it was free was great. Connection was fast and I had no issues. It was a nice hotel and I will stay here again. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Harvey13
Reviews.Content: On booking a touring holiday with a well known company I wondered what the various hotels would be like. I can honestly say the Best Western Primrose Hotel, Toronto Downtown was one of the very best I have had the pleasure of staying in. Everything was spotlessly clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful and polite. I would certainly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonya M
Reviews.Content: We had to travel from Praga to Toronto with my parents, to see some family. We stayed the 3 of us in same room, so we had to pay a very good rate. Thanks to the low price we could stay for a week. We were afraid that a 3 star would not be too good, but I am glad we found this hotel that is great for the price. Now I know I can go more times without blowing away our budget. Rooms are big enough that 3 people can sleep very confortable while paying only one room. All is clean and nicely decorated. The concierge and waitresses very nice. It is also important that you have many choices around of the hotel to have dinner of lunch of restaurants. I keep this hotel in my list.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Hotel at Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: I was very happy at my stay at Toronto, and pleased with the hotel selection too. I travel in a budget and the quality of the hotel overall was excellent for the price we payed. I loved the Jasmine Garden restaurant close to the hotel. Also it is very close to bars. Of course we went to other restaurants as we love french cuisine too. Rooms where confortable with adequate size. The staff well mannered, all clean. I recommend this hotel for medium type budgets, and for a cosmopolitan experience at Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All Primrose!”
Reviews.Author: melissa21forlife
Reviews.Content: So we went to Toronto for a girlâ€™s weekend out and booked 2 rooms at the Primrose Hotel online after finding a good deal on Hotwire. We were able to get adjoining rooms which was perfect and each had 2 beds in them. The hotel was in a good location and it was easy to get a cab just outside the hotel to the clubs. The staff were really nice. We had a small issue on check out as a long distance call which we did not place (we didnâ€™t know anyone in Seattle) got accidently added to our bill, but they reversed the charge so it wasnâ€™t a major issue. If you are staying here be warned about the parking though. Its really tight down there, but there is also a public lot outside which you can use. I drive a smaller car so had no issues, but I think someone in a mini van might have trouble. We had a fantastic weekend out, and the hotel was perfect for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Goven
Reviews.Content: On the upside this place is reasonable priced and the rooms are clean, quiet, and with comfortable beds. The downside is outside the area it is a bit rough with people standing about smoking and hanging out. The staff while not rude are not as friendly as one would expect. Beware of what looks like a continental breakfast as it is not nor are there any signs indicating charge. The breakfast is $12.95 for pre cooked eggs, bacon,etc. There are much better deals just down the street. Or grab a coffee and bagel at the Tim Hortons right next door. As a solo female traveler I would not walk around the area at night so if you are travelling on your own other hotels near restaurants and services might be a better idea.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: nootychoo
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for a three night stay at the beginning of my holiday to Canada, and was very pleased with my choice. Room was spacious, spotlessly clean and I had a great view of the Toronto skyline from the 19th floor. All the staff I encountered were friendly and couldn't have been more helpful, which I found very reassuring as a lone female traveller on her first trip to Canada. Shame they couldn't have arranged the weather!! The hotel is within an easy walk to many attractions and shops, with a subway station close by for venturing further afield. Thank you very much Best Western Primrose. All

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jacksonfive55
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a weekend â€œstaycationâ€� and got a cheap room online at the Primrose Hotel. I was happy overall with the hotel and had no real complaints. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was a bit of a wait for the elevators but a group had just checked in, so had to wait a few extra minutes while the 50 plus ppl all went up. No big deal though. The room itself was nice. Had a room with 1 king bed which was comfortable. It was clean, and the housekeeper who came the next morning was friendly. The hotel itself is in a good location. While we werenâ€™t right on the main street (Yonge Street), it was literally only 2 blocks away, and took less then 3 minutes to get there. Lots of good restaurants in the area too. Not a bad place to spend a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: Came for 1 night to see a concert and stayed at the Primrose Hotel since it was close to the club. Was a good stay. Room was clean and quite and the bed was really confortable. Loved the Tim Hortons in the Lobby the next morning. Would stay there again as price was great and location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Toronto at the Primrose Hotel. ItÂ´s in a good location and walking distance to most places. The hotel is really nice. The rooms are nice and clean and have a great view. Staff are helpful and friendly. Was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Jake M
Reviews.Content: Went to the leafs game on Saturday and stayed at the Primrose Hotel as it seemed like the city was full. The price was good and the location was close to the ACC, so was a good choice. Happy overall with the hotel. The room was clean, the check in and out was fast and the staff were always smiling. This hotel is a good pick for those who want to be downtown but donâ€™t want to pay huge dollars to stay right in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bright and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: gene h
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in Toronto on our way to Montreal and booked in at the Primrose Hotel. We did not have a room reserved and were happy they were able to take us without a reservation. We were pleased with the choice, and the location was perfect. The hotel was close to some of the places we visited (Hockey Hall of Fame the clear winner with the kids). The room was large and had 2 queen beds in it. The staff were very friendly and cheery and the kids also liked the Tim Hortons in the lobby for the donuts. The price was also quite reasonable. The entire hotel was very bright and the rooms were very clean. It was a great last minute choice and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: stan b
Reviews.Content: The yearly family vacation happened in Toronto this time. My wife and I really enjoy this time we have to spend with the kids while they still think these trips are "cool". We have used Best Western before once on a trip to Michigan and had a miserable stay so very reluctantly we booked the Primrose. The staff at checkin was quick to notice our children were a little fussy and provided crayons and coloring books that calmed them right down, The room was huge complete with microwave and small fridge so we could warm up left over which is always important travelling with kids. Overall we were very pleased with the quality of the hotel and the service. We recommened this hotel for families and we will certainly be coming back. The coffee shop Tim Hortons in the lobby has wonderful baked goods not good for the wasteline buttasted great, Thanks Primrose.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: My travels landed me in Toronto and I booked in at the Primrose Best Western hotel. It is in a great location and was able to walk to some great restaurants and shopping places. The room was great, and I was given room 1705 which had a king bed and a fantastic view. It was really clean, and the housekeeping lady was very friendly and always asking if I needed any additional toiletries or coffee. The front desk staff were superb and went out of their way to help with one girl at the front desk loaning me her personal umbrella so I could go to the shops without getting soaked. The price was great, and the rooms large. This place is a definite choice when I return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: Carey W
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a conference which was being held at another hotel close by. Although it would have been more convenient for me to stay at the hotel the meeting was in, their prices were far too expensive for my budget. I got a room at the Best Western Primrose for a very reasonable rate. Even with the cost of the taxi to and from the conference, it was still much cheaper then the other room rate. The hotel was great, and I was pleased with the room. I thought the rooms were very well kept and the bedding looked new. I was also glad that the hotel had free internet access as I had to spend a great deal of time working, and not having to lug everything to a computer room instead of working from my bedroom was very convenient. The staff were friendly and helpful in arranging for taxiâ€™s for me, and always greeted me with a smile. When traveling on business again, I would not hesitate to use this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Always consistent!”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal for business and when I am in Toronto which is usually about 2 -3 nights a month, I always stay at the Primrose Best Western Hotel. The location is perfect for me and close to everything. What really impresses me though is the consistency the hotel has. I have been given a different room each time and am always pleased with the fact that all the rooms are in the same condition and that no room is â€œworseâ€� than another. I always get a desk for working and the room is always clean. The staff are always friendly, and now that I am visiting frequently, always greet me by name. The other thing I like is the free wireless internet. I have never had an issue with this and always get fast and stable service. Each time I come in, I am given a new password and never have any issues logging on. The hotel also has a printer available that I use when needed. This hotel is perfect for me, and will continue to use it when I travel to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “We Have Good Time!”
Reviews.Author: Allan1972
Reviews.Content: Had really good stay in Toronto and got room at Primrose hotel which is in the city downtown area. We liked the hotel very much. We got room 1704 and it was very big and the bed was large. We liked to walk in the area and found that there is a big shopping mall a few blocks away and we liked to walk there to go shopping. We really like the staff at the hotel. The man at the front was very friendly and help us get tickets to the subway and give us maps to get around. He spent much time with us and we were grateful for the help. The man in the restaurant was also very friendly and the food was very good in the breakfast time. I like the hotel and hope to go back one day more sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Student Campus”
Reviews.Author: toomanyholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights, good location, nice room, friendly front desk. BUT hotel seemed to be fully booked out to groups of students, therefore the noise from nearby rooms especially at night was really annoying. The elevators were very busy with students visiting each other between floors it took us nearly 15 minutes to get from 19th floor to car park level one evening. I am not sure whether this was a regular event at this hotel or we were just unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Internet Speeds and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Had to go to Toronto for a meeting and stayed at the Primrose Hotel as the hotel the conference was in was sold out. It was in a good location as it was close to everything and only a short walk to the conference. The staff was extremely helpful with directions and the lady at the front desk (forget her name, but she was a British lady) was extremely accommodating and did everything she could to get me a room well before check in. The room itself was great. Large king bed, large desk to work at and free internet access really helped. I was actually quite impressed with the speed as I am used to slow internet connections in hotels, and this one was a great deal faster then what I am used to. My experience was one that would not give me any hesitations to stay at the property again when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: johnymartin
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with my trip to Toronto and the Primrose Hotel last week. Stayed for a total of 3 nights and was given a room with a king size bed and a nice working area. Was happy with the room overall, although I do wish that they had room service. The hotel itself seems to have undergone some renovations in the near past as I noticed the elevators looked newer in style. They do have a restaurant and bar which was open every night I was there, and it served quite a few different dishes, but nothing of more ethnic cuisine. There is an amazing Thai place just down the street called the Jasmine Garden and it is definitely worth a visit if you are in the area. Overall, the staff were very friendly and helpful with getting taxis in the morning. The housekeeping staff were fantastic though and went above and beyond when I realized 2 days after I checked out that I left my phone charger in the room and got it back to me. Would stay at the hotel again on my next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: kerleigh
Reviews.Content: No complaints about anything. Nice clean room, nice neighbourhood, walking distance to subway, shopping, theatres, etc. More than I'd like to pay for a few hours sleep but hey, it's downtown, we paid for location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel check-in ever!”
Reviews.Author: MaWenLi
Reviews.Content: I had been booking all my stays with Best Western hotels lately but this branch, Best Western Primrose Downtown Toronto, was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. It almost ruined our vacation. Our flight arrived too early for hotel check-in. We know that we can't be accomodated at 9am. But we still made a request, if ever a room is already available for we haven't slept yet and very tired from our flight. The reception people were very unfriendly and arrogant. They were two young ladies, a healthy Asian and a skinny Caucasian. No greetings, not even a friendly welcome. They told us to come back by 12nn for there might be a room. We decided to have breakfast (fantastic dimsum in Chinatown) outside and walk around the area to kill time. We came back at noon and saw a great number of people checking out. We saw that they were really busy so we stayed at the lobby. By 1pm, we approached the reception again and they even become more rude and unfriendly. She said that no room is available yet and that we will be notified once a room becomes available. Does this hotel only have one cleaning lady? I called Member's assistance hotline to make a complain but she only made matters worst. She told me that Best Western hotels are franchises and the owners have their own rules on how to manage the hotel. Hilarious. And to think that I just recently became an Elite member of their rewards program. Anyways, to make the matter worst, we saw several couples checking in and got a room ahead of us. We pointed this matter to the reception but they ignored us. We fell asleep several times at the lobby seating area and by 230pm, we asked the Caucasian lady again. This time she came out of the room with a mouthful of her lunch, checked the computer rapidly and voila, we have a room. They didn't inform us immediately to think that we were seating in front of the,. As if they just let us wait until the very last minute. They don't have compassion and concern about their guests. You should know that it is my first time as an Elite member and I read from the mail sent to me that Elite members will be prioritized and be given a special key card. Neither was given to me. The Caucasian lady just handed me an ordinary key card without saying anything, no good wishes for a pleasant stay. She went back immediately to the room while we were still at the counter. We heard them murmuring and laughing. How inappropriate was that? The room given to us was big. It has enough space to move around. The coffee maker, heating and lighting worked well. The bed and pillows was comfirtable, too. But the room has a very strong smell of smoke, the carpet needs cleaning and the bathroom has a lot of hairs on the floor, walls and tub. The hallways needs carpet cleaning and more lighting. The elevators were too slow. This hotel needs a major overhaul. A middle-aged man, who seems to be the manager or supervisor, made our check-out pleasant. He was friendly and nice. Same with the doorman who never fails to greet the guests. I will never stay in this hotel or in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: perrin99
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was central and we had miles to use up. The hotel is basic and clean. Service is almost non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: Went to the Primrose with my g/f for a romantic getaway and stayed at the Primrose Hotel since it was close to the restaurant and theatre. Was a nice place. Got a room on the 22nd floor with 1 king bed and a great view. The room was nice, although I wish they had room service. They even were able to get some roses put in the room before we arrived as a surprise. The staff were really cool and the place was in a good location. We didnâ€™t use the restaurant as there was a place next door which served an all day breakfast for cheap so we slept in and went there one morning. Pool was good â€“ it was outside so able to get some sun tanning in too. It was a great weekend and my g/f was really surprised. I would probably go back again. Nice Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel , Safe, comfortable , clean and in a great location !”
Reviews.Author: Molly25x
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here for 11 nights in July 2011 with my boyfriend. We had previously booked a guesthouse which turned out to be awful so we where in a bit of a panic to get somewhere nice and affordable. The lady in reception was very helpful and kind, she got us a very good room at a reasonable price. We got a room on the 16th floor with great views of the city , Our room had a big comfortable double bed. Tv,mircowave, fridge,cooker,coffee maker, climate control,couch desk ,hairdryer and toiletries and wi fi access. Everyday Our bed was made up with fresh sheets ,the was rubbish emptied and clean towels were provided. There was also a business room where you could enjoy free internet and use of the fax and printer. Also to our delight there was a fitness centre, swimming pool and a sauna. The hotel had very alert security staff also there was a safety deposit boxes behind reception to keep your valuables safe . We have never been to Canada before or to a huge city like Toronto, we found it very easy to get around, Primrose hotel is an excellent location as the subway is only 5min walk way .There is a lot of restaurants , bars, stores ,drugmarts and shops within walking distance also Dundas sq , Eaton centre &hockey Hall of Fame are close by. Whenever we wanted to go somewhere and were'nt sure the consirge in the hotel would tell us how and provided handy little maps. All in all I would definately recommend this hotel. If I ever return to Toronto I will be staying there again. In a nutshell it was affordable clean comfortable, the staff where friendly .. we felt safe here and the stay was very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, will never be back”
Reviews.Author: ManishMaheshwari28
Reviews.Content: Rude appearing staff. No smiles in any of the faces. Looks very disgruntled employees they have got. Could not sleep the very first night, A/C making too much of rattling noise. A/C not cooling enough. Almost decided to move to another hotel, but didn't because didn't want to go in hassle of moving the luggage with kids, etc. Reported the problem to staff, they say it is very common, not to worry. Not enough lighting. Gloomy room. No freshness feeling at all. Despite it being a kitchenette, it was a joke to have a little stove, no cutleries provided unless asked. Even provided ones were not washed by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip!”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: So this family vacation was a short stop in Toronto and then onto Niagara falls. We stayed in Toronto at the Primrose hotel which was great cuz it was right downtown. The kids had a blast in the pool and the lifeguard there was amazing. The hotel has everything we needed and the room was clean and large for the family. The restaurant was also a great deal since our kids ate free from the buffet since they are younger. Hotel also was able to give us a crib for the 2 year old which was good as my wife was worried he would fall out of bed. Was a great start to our mini vacation and looking forward now to seeing the falls.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Briangogo W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently attended a wedding in Toronto and stayed at the Primrose Hotel as it was close to the reception. We were pleased with the service we received. We were given room 1904 which had a large king bed and sitting area. The room was clean and well decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable. I found however that the room was a little dark at night though as there were several lamps but only an overhead light by the door. The staff were very pleasant and we had no issues with them. We did not use the restaurant in the hotel but did enjoy the Tim Hortons coffee shop beside the check in area. We had a good time in the city and would use the Primrose Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Short Trip, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jenweinberg
Reviews.Content: Visiting a friend here and was a perfect stay while in town. Great coffee and quick service. Works for me, will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, dirty stained rooms. Never going back.”
Reviews.Author: LAP1986
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the staff was very helpful and friendly, the elevators were extreemly crowded and small. Seemed like it took forever any time we ever wanted to go anywhere. One elevator was stuck on a floor so there were only 3 in use. Paying for parking was never mentioned when I booked our room. 23 extra dollars charged to the room. Our room was dirty and had stains all over the floors. there was even garbage in between our night stand. Our bed didn't have a fitted sheet. Just a top sheet laid over the nasty mattress. Our AC didn't work either, the room was small. Bathroom was disgusting and we will never stay there again. Location is great, but we were up all night with drunk people arriving back to their rooms. Worst hotel i've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Zbank
Reviews.Content: Â I recently went to Toronto and stayed at the Primrose. Â I stayed in a standard business room. Twas spacious & clean. Gym was great. Will be back ! Â

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and clean”
Reviews.Author: sunseeking17
Reviews.Content: Nice Lobby - staff friendly but she was alone. We had a nice room with two queen beds and a nice view of the city. Located at College and Jarvis very close to Queens Park, Eaton Center, China Town, Kensington Market, Sony Center, Canon Theater, Scotia Square, KPMG, and Queens Quay. Bathrooms are a bit dated. Beds were clean and comfortable. - triple sheeted. Breakfast was contintental for 9.99. Many restaurants with good food nearby. For those who remember! it is across from the old Maple Leaf Gardens. Nic ebusiness center - 4 computers available. Outdoor pool. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was lovely, Parking a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: canadathebeautiful
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel this past weekend. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. We had a kitchenette in our room, which was nice and perfect for those that are staying for an extended period of time. Hotel staff were very friendly. Location is fine, close to the subway and easy to get down to the theatre district, shopping and waterfront. The elevators are very slow and you wait for extended periods for them. Parking and getting access to the parking garage was a nightmare. Can't understand why they have such a security system for the parking garage, when there are no garage doors at the entrance and exit, so anyone from the street can walk down the ramps and access the vehicles, but the guests have to follow a security protoccol, which did not work and a whole elevator of guests had to be escorted through the back hallways and elevators to get to the garage. Up until that point, we were very pleased with the hotel, but the parking nightmare has changed our mind about wanting to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms, friendly staff, well maintained!”
Reviews.Author: stevefranco2219
Reviews.Content: Came into Toronto to meet up with some friends for a concert, booked a room on Hotwire looking for a good deal. Wasn't familiar with this Best Western, but I was hoping it wasn't like a few I had stated at on a trip to Florida last year. Luckily it wasn't like any Best Western I had ever been to - this is a large full service hotel. First thing I noticed was they had a Tim Horton's in the lobby, sweet! Ultra friendly staff at the desk - they let me check in a couple of hours early. Room was BIG, bed was comfy, had an a good size fridge in it too and it's the first hotel I've been to in a while where the internet was free and fast. Area was pretty cool too, lots of little restaurants in walking distance (great Chinese place right across the street.) And just like my stay out at the airport, I made the mistake of not paying attention to the breakfast prices before I started ordering. What is it with $20 hotel breakfasts in Toronto? Anyway, I saw a sign for a breakfast place right next door that said $4.99 bacon & eqqs - I'll know for next time. Highly recommended for the price!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better values downtown”
Reviews.Author: ramblingsalesman
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms were dated but spotless, internet was great. Parking was awful!!! Do not park here! Its 20 bucks and you'll spend the better part of an hour trying to shoe-horn your car into a spot the size of a postage stamp. Park around the corner at the public lot, 4 bucks cheaper and much less grief. Tim Horton's Kiosk on the first floor which is great for morning coffee. Staff was always helpful. Night-time security is a pain but I suppose neccesary, they checked my room key and ID before letting me to the elevator at 2am after having been out with friends. I've probably stayed there 20 times over the years and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Good friends Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: zzboy421
Reviews.Content: Met some long time friends in toronto for the weekend, I decided to come into town last minuet and found the primrose cause the delta gave my room away? The hotel is older but the room was huge and had a view all the way to the lake. Staff was pleasant enough and made a point to call after i checked in to see how i was. My friends and I enjoyed the weekend it was fun. I will come back to Primrose.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: lolalolitaCanada
Reviews.Content: I was forced to take this room because the client was too cheap to pay for a decent hotel. It is a large hotel in downtown Toronto with unhappy, unhelpful employees who do not do their job well. Granted not every employee may fit this characterization, but it is obviously a large contingent of them based on the state of the hotel. On arrival, the guy at the reception was professional enough but it went downhill from there. The hotel is in serious need of a facelift. Everything must date from the 80s but it is not so much the old tired decor as it is for lack of cleanliness. The room has old dirty and stained carpetting and chairs. The bathroom is old, but the floor was dirty and the faucet still had toothpaste stains from the previous guest. The toilet had not been cleaned as evidenced by the grey / orange hard water stains and had a big black stain under the rim. Since it was late and I was only staying one night, I decided that I would not take a shower because of the lack of cleanliness of the bathroom. I did not have the energy to change rooms so I just went to bed, which was surprising very comfortable, as were the pillows. The next morning, I went to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant. As I came in, the waiter was on the phone and told me to sit down; the buffet is 8.95$ or I could order from the menu. He hung up and then left and did not come back for a while, so I did the same. I took a look at the buffet...don't waste your time, money, or calories for this buffet. Just outside to the left of the hotel is a greasy spoon called the Golden Diner. Breakfast is huge and really good, served by a sociable waiter names Josh. Checkout took 20 minutes because there was only one woman at the reception. Customer service is not her forte. Parking is 23$ and very narrow so don't even think of trying to get an SUV in there. There is a parking lot right next door on Jarvis. Whoever is managing this hotel should be fired and blacklisted. The employees that I had the displeasure of interacting with seem so unhappy to be working there that it shows in their demeanor and the quality of the work they do. For something this evident, it is systemic and evidence of poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: kaktaka
Reviews.Content: This place is a total dump! Stayed there for a week and that was more than enough. During this time the room was not vacuumed even once!! All they did was making the beds and for the rest nothing, The bathroom already had hairs when we came and they stayed there the whole time. The area is terrible as well- full with beggers and junkies that stop you each time you near the hotel,asking for money and cigarretes. And the management of the hotel does not do anything about it,which I can not understand. Once there was even a wasted guy sleeping on a couch on the second floor and nobody bothered to kick him out. The people at the administration were also kind of rude and totally uninterested in their guests. They were answering questions very shortly and looking bothered. The location is so-so. It's in downtown,however you have to walk at least 20 min to Eaton Centre. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone and for sure won't stay there ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: c_dubToronto
Reviews.Content: Our room was decent but i noticed that the bathroom was not very clean. There was dust and hair on the heater vent and there was still cleanser powder in our toilet when we arrived at 4pm. Perhaps they forgot to finish and this was a one time thing but I can't help thinking "if I can see this, what can I not see?" Beds were comfortable and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Parking was a bit rediculous; one person says you pay for it there and the next person says you add it on to your room so we really weren't sure what we were supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MarkTron
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location, within walking distance of everything touristy. The price is very good and the rooms are large, the only issue with the hotel is its very dated and could do with a revamp. I stayed just under two weeks and I'd use them again.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located but a bit aged”
Reviews.Author: Tyro2
Reviews.Content: the hotel is centrally located and is very comfortable with a nice bed and rooms cleaned daily. The hotel however seems to be ageing with the air con unit making a loud grinding noise and shower water sometimes talking hours to drain from the bath tub due to a blockage. Overall, not perfect but good value for money. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: jan6494
Reviews.Content: After arriving from england to find our original hotel double booked we ended up at the primrose for a whole month. we found our rooms very clean and were cleaned daily. staff were very helpful and friendly. tim hortons was very handy. coffee and donut!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, small bathroom, excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: dougsgirls12
Reviews.Content: I had a conference to go to that was in this hotel. We got an excellent rate because we were doing business in the hotel. The room was very large but made for a small bathroom. Very big comfortable bed. There are a lot of students there so it made the elevators very slow at meal times. But all the students I met were very nice and respectful. The underground parking is horribly laid out. We had many people coming for this conference that had scratched their cars or some that cracked their exhaust pipe. I would stay here again but I would park elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great night sleep!”
Reviews.Author: peachychick
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great price. Went on Bestwestern.com and booked the room online for $89.00 a night. Very clean and the beds were VERY comfortable. You also got two pillows each without asking. Also very quite and it was spring break. The parking garage was a tight squeeze if you were driving anything bigger than a four door car. Don't know how some of the vans got down there! Was very safe and you could only access the parking lot with a hotel key. A Cora's breakfast and Starbucks was two blocks away. There was a Tim Hortons in the lobby too. Didn't try the restaurant....got there late! We are going to stay there again for sure next time we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was expecting!”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: The fact that we were returning from an exotic, tropical holiday, made it important that our transit night in freezing Toronto was a pleasant one. As it turned out, it was. The room was large with a very comfortable mattress. Made for an excellent sleep. No noise. Great view from the 16th floor. If we would have been in town for even a few days, the kitchenette would have been put to good use. It was much better than many others we've seen. Larger than normal room fridge. The bathroom was a good size and well lit. Nothing fancy but everything worked well. Clean. Wifi worked ok. Check in was great. The staff were friendly and efficient. After having been out for the evening, a friendly security person made certain that we were guests, prior to being allowed onto the elevators. The location gave us convenient access to downtown Toronto. Wasn't a long drive back to the airport, either. Can't speak to the amenities. We weren't there long enough! For our purposes, however, it worked out very well.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ladnerlad
Reviews.Content: Our room was good, the bed very good - but it was disappointing to find that the "new and exciting Primrose Restaurant and Bar where no expense had been spared" (according to their brochure) was CLOSED except for breakfast time. It was the middle of winter with temperatures around minus-10 to minus-20 degrees and we had to trudge the streets to find places to eat. The Wi-Fi service in the room was undependable, the 40+ kgb reception would suddenly drop to 1Kgb and unuseable, then it would flip up to perhaps 18 kbs and back to 1 kgb. Very frustrating. However the staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the grand piano in the lobby was attractive but never played!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: KarinT_11
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, but factor in the low prices, great location and little perks like free wi-fi, and I'd say that it's one of the best I've stayed in. Not a luxury hotel by any means, but great value for the price. The room was big, clean and quite nice, the bed was very comfortable, there was plenty of hot water... the basics were covered. I found the staff to be helpful and courteous as well. A few very minor complaints - the bathroom was very small and a bit cold, since the only heat was from a small baseboard heater. The TV had something wrong with it and made a loud buzzing noise the whole time it was on, but since I wasn't there to watch TV that wasn't a big deal. I didn't eat at the restaurant, so can't comment on that. Overall, a good experience and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable good value”
