Reviews.Author: football0113
Reviews.Content: East Lothian Scotland. We stayed here for 6 nights.Before we arrived we read previous reviews and were a bit apprehensive. However on arriving found the hotel room to be very spacious, clean and very comfortable. We were on the 22nd floor and the view was to die for. The maid came in everyday to clean and leave fresh towels. There was also always plenty of hot water for Baths/showers. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Also the hotel was in a very good location for all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good”
Reviews.Author: crystart
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, update elevators....no problems overall. Fair price, but 1 block away is a bad part of town and this part of town appears to be "gay". Underground metro is about 4-5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: StubbleJumper
Reviews.Content: I wan't expecting much from this hotel and that's what I got. The general feeling of this hotel was tired and run down. We had to switch rooms the first night due to plumbing issues (shower didn't work, toilet leaked). Only good thing was that it was a few blocks from the subway.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: beans679
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a reasonable location and has a Tim Hortons just off the lobby which is handy for a quick snack. The room was ok - it was clean but a little tired looking - some staff were ok but others were a bit abrupt and scruffy looking. In the end pleased we were only staying for two nights

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, No Problems, Good LOcation”
Reviews.Author: brianp021
Reviews.Content: What is wrong with people? This is a good hotel we had no problems with our stay or room. The room was clean there were no stains anywhere, nice bed and dÃ©cor was good. People stay in hotels and expect them to be newly decorated for them rooms have to be used and accommodating. We use many hotels and in our stays, at Best Westerns all over the world have not had a bad one in the chain. Reception staff were polite and respected us, if you give staff respect we always find they give respect back, if you treat staff without respect what do you expect in return? Even housekeeping spoke to us in a morning and passed the time of day. The porterage was efficient and the bell boys were polite. We stayed with a tour on 9/10 September and would have no hesitation at staying or recommending this hotel again. My partner has worked in hotels for over 30 years and a lot of it in management and he would know a bad one as soon as he walked in. We normally take pictures of the rooms we stay in but unforunately did not on this occassion, if had they would have been put on here good or bad.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Seanpod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far disgusting! The rooms ar esooo gross. There were stains on the couch, hair in the shower, and body hairs on the floor. The room wasnt clean and the Worst part I got BED BUG BITES!!!!! The staff were also incrediably rude. If you know whats good for you DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this "AAA recommended" dive!”
Reviews.Author: GEaton
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin... 1) parking garage full when we arrived - had to street park and immediately got a $30 ticket because we didn't understand the parking protocol. 2) were not put up in the room that we booked; the Ontario Hells Angels had just arrived for their convention (not kidding). The manager was no where to be scene as he was dealing with their room problems so we opted to just make due with what we got because the assistant was overwhelmed and not very professional. 3) room was definitely not No Smoking like we requested, the halls stunk like stale cigarette smoke and we could smell the smoke from the people out in the halls smoking. Also, some (apparent) students had booked the room 2 doors down and were having a party. Fortunately, the last loud talkers and occasional screaming ended by 11pm. 4) Room was dirty and tired...carpet looked like it was not vacuumed after the previous guests...picked up skirt of bed and found: bottle cap, dirty plastic fork, leather strip (probably from the Fetish Festival) and other debris. Looked like it had never been vacuumed. The towel rack in bathroom was ripped out of the wall on one side. In 3 days we never saw one cleaner's kart in the hall (as opposed to the other hotels we stayed at during our 2-wk trip). 5) found out the hotel was on the edge of college town and gay section...when we walked to Chinatown with our boys (ages 11 and 15) we were treated to open-window pole dancing and the Gay Fetish Festival (not kidding). 6) the wifi never worked. 7) BED BUGS (I had bites around my ankles and on my chest and boy did they itch for days). Disgusting place! I cannot believe AAA recommends this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: s_ingsK1Y
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Best Western Primrose in the past year and I would have no hestitation in staying again. I booked a smoking room with a king-size bed. It was a business class room, which I didn't really need, but I had anticipated having someone else come along on this trip. The room also included a sofa bed. The room was spacious and clean with an extremely comfortable bed. Is the hotel showing signs of wear? Sure, it's not a new hotel. If I looked closely I could see where the wallpaper had been patched in a spot near the bed's headboard. It wasn't obvious and I only noticed it because I was accessing a wall plug behind the bedside table. The carpet could use replacing for staining, but it wasn't dirty, just old. The lobby was clean, as was the elevator. Checking in and out was very quick. The staff were friendly and efficient. The location is great. Close enough to walk to the Eaton Centre. Close to good restaurants. The subway station is only a few blocks away and the street car passes right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! I couldn't believe it!”
Reviews.Author: voxframe
Reviews.Content: First things first, I travel quite a bit so I do have a solid base to compare hotels, and I honestly couldn't believe some reviews of hotels where people call them gross and disgusting... That is until now. This place is beyond downhill. It's downright nasty. It's a used and abused NewYork apartment. Walls are cracked, wallpaper peeling, mold in the bathroom, mysterious smell, windows that apparently leaked onto the sills, cob-webs in the corners, furniture in SAD condition (I mean chunks taken out of the desk), chairs with the arms worn off, no attempt at cleaning the walls (Looks like someone blew their nose on it) covered in dust, buttons missing on TV, one broken lamp... etc... Totally disgusting! And worse is I can compare it to other Best Westerns, and they are all quite nice, but this one is horrible. Never coming back here, that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Strange things at this place”
Reviews.Author: johnscs
Reviews.Content: I came for a vacation and got complete hell. This location had some sort of crack addict conference whereby I found blood in the elevator. I then tried to get some sleep but couldn't as the room I was in was so dusty. The next day when leaving the building I was approached by homeless people, and asked to spare change. This area seems dodgy to me!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: leo321
Reviews.Content: Very quiet, about 3 or 4 blocks away from the downtown core (Eaton center...). Clean rooms, spacious, and usually at a good price. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “ageing hotel in great location offers big rooms and decent gym”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: for what this place costs I definitely recommend this hotel. it's clearly aging, but on the plus side, this means large rooms that were impeccably clean on check-in and throughout my week-long stay. i ended up in a two double beds room near the top floor. the beds were fantastic. i slept wonderfully. there's an in-house tim hortons in case you don't want the very affordable breakfast buffet. the pool area is scarily dirty, full with pigeons, so you might want to skip this offering to stay well. the gym is located in two adjacent rooms, and for the price category of this hotel is nothing to complain about. the helpful general manager had broken equipment really repaired over night. i didn't expect this! three cheers to him! cable tv is a nuisance, there's no international news channel to be had (unless you think CNN America is). there's free - and mostly slow but functional - wireless internet access included in the room rate. great stuff, not one of those sneaky hotels that tries to sell you this sort of thing at extortionate rates after you booked. in case you like gay nightlife, church street is just around the corner :). to those folks who complain so bitterly about this hotel... perhaps try the fairmont and pay several times what you paid. i suspect then you'd have reason to complain. to those who compla

Reviews.Title: “alright...but needs some renovating”
Reviews.Author: gone_aforeign
Reviews.Content: The hotel is alright..but in dire need of some renovation. The rooms seemed musty...and slightly dirty. The view and location compensated for it (slightly). Staff was friendly and because all the other hotels were booked out, I had not choice but to reside at the Primerose for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and surly staff”
Reviews.Author: cdnwalker
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very abrupt and unwelcoming and when I asked about parking simply waved me over to the concierge. The conciege never stopped leaning on his podium and snapped, "Parking $23.00 around the corner," and turned away. All further contact with the front desk was the same. (I asked, "Where can I go for clothes shopping?" The reply, "Walk that way!") My first impression was that they would rather I had not sullied their doorstep. I was so upset that I have taken the trouble to write this. I would ignore the run down bathroom and tired furniture had the staff been slightly friendly or slightly helpful. (In fairness, the fellow in the breakfast room was jolly and very helpful.)

Reviews.Title: “Not to be trusted”
Reviews.Author: Seelye
Reviews.Content: Regardless of being on the fringes of a very "colorful" community, there was one incident that soured our stay at the Primrose. We accidently left a piece of jewelry in the room. Despite our best efforts to convey how irreplaceable it was, housekeeping claimed not to have seen it. We are heartbroken and will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty satisfactory.”
Reviews.Author: Dallasbunny
Reviews.Content: Location a few blocks from Yonge street where all the shops and restaurants are. Swimming pool only open when lifeguard is there from 10a to 9p. Musty smell, but pretty clean in the room. Hallways dingy, but staff is nice and helpful. Relatively safe neighborhood in the "gay" area, but there were a few crazies walking the streets and some just high on drugs. Several blocks walking to Eaton Center, the shopping mall nearby. Great beef swarma pita sandwiches nearby esp. the one across the street from the "Made in China" chinese restaurant, which was decent cheap eats on it's own! Free soda with meal at "Made in China" and dinner specials from $5.99! Close to CN tower too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: s_ingsK1Y
Reviews.Content: All we wanted was a place to lay our heads, somewhere fairly central. And affordable. This met all those criteria. The beds were comfy, the staff friendly and accommodating. The hotel is close enough to the subway to make winter sightseeing feasible. Our only complaint was a buzzing noise from the television that required us to turn it up slightly to watch TV before bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: timbuck4
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the other reviews, I was apprehensive about staying there. The room was clean, and had a great view. The staff was friendly. The rooms are in need of a remodel. The bathrooms are dated. If you are looking for an expensive four or five star hotel, don't stay here. This hotel is near everything; subway, restaurants, shopping. It offers a good value and excellent location. I parked my car in the garage for two days and took the subway.

Reviews.Title: “really nice!”
Reviews.Author: kimciara
Reviews.Content: I'm quite surprised to read the negative reviews about this hotel! I stayed there for three nights last week and we had a really great stay. The hotel was located really close to the College subway stop so we onyl had a short walk. Upon arrival, the receptionist was very pleasant and the doorman held an elevator ready for us. Our room was on the 22nd floor and we has INCREDIBLE views of Toronto. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were so soft! People have said that the location wasn't safe but we had no problems with it at all. The doorman got to know us and was always pleasant to us when we arrived - asking about our day. On the thrid floor, there is a business suite where you can avail of free internet access and a sauna which we didn't have time to try out. The Tim Hortons in the hotel was a great way to start a day too! I will mark it down for two things - 1) The bath in our room was quite old and slightly discoloured at the bottom. But I took showers so it didn't affect me. 2) The airport shuttle that the hotel reccomend costs $50 per person. We would have taken this if we didn't find out that if you go the the subway at College (about 5 minute walk) and get off at Lawrence West, you can get a bus outside that goes directly to departures at Pearon Airport. This costs a total of $3!! Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay and I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Most disgusting room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mps1ualberta
Reviews.Content: This was my first time travelling to Toronto and I must say this hotel ruined it for me. I booked this hotel, because I expected a certain cleanliness that comes with Best Western franchise's. My first room had a window that would not close, so I did not have much time to look around, I went to the front desk and asked to have my room switched. The front desk operator made me feel like it was a nuicence for him to switch my room. My second room also had a window that would not close, there were beer caps scattered throughout the room, there was hair in the tub and on the toilet seat, and the room smelt like an ashtray. I would never ever stay at this hotel again, and may never stay at a best western again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Room Prices; Comfy Sleep for 12 Nights!”
Reviews.Author: bjkitty
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Toronto for medical reasons which required a 12 night stay. After doing much research, I found this to be an acceptable hotel. We had one of their kitchenette rooms that had a microwave, small fridge, coffee maker and counter/sink area; complete with utensils, although I brought my own disposable ones. The beds/pillows are by far the best feature. They are comfortable with nice bedding. The bathroom was average. The view overlooked the downtown area and was close to hospitals if you were up for a brisk walk. The biggest disappointments were: -Elevators (being "updated", bumpy ride, not reliable-ended up on a floor we didn't know we could access!) -Restaurant (Was not regularly opened. Had daily continental or hot breakfast for an unreasonable cost for the 'menu' - try the local restaurants or delivery) Overall, reasonable cost for duration; comfortable, quiet, clean rooms; and you receive Best Western Club points or Airmiles for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “I found nothing wrong with this hotel, overall a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Until_It_Sleeps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because compared to the other hotels in Toronto it was a good price for a room with 2 beds. I only stayed one night, and I haven't traveled extensively, but what do people expect? A red carpet rolled out for them and people falling over backwards to serve their every desire? I live in the real world, and was quite content with this hotel. I arrived in the early afternoon with my friends and we checked in. It took a little while to get up to the receptionist as there was quite a line, but they were friendly enough. Got up to the room and it was clean. A little small for a double but nothing terrible. We had an excellent view of the downtown skyline from our room on one of the higher floors facing South. Better yet, we were a 20 minute walk from the shores of Lake Ontario. In all we walked to Queens Quay and were on the ferry to Toronto Island inside of half an hour which wasn't bad at all. The area wasn't bad. My friends and I went out at midnight to eat and had no difficulties, even in the Church & Gerrard area near the hotel which I have heard can be rough. I would stay here again, though I would probably be more likely to try other hotels just for a new experience. I would also like to thank the people leaving paranoid reviews on here for opening my eyes up to how intolerable some people are, which will no doubt help me sift through the hotel reviews for my upcoming trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could say it was better!”
Reviews.Author: G0URMANDE
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to Toronto before and this hotel, I would consider to be below average. Although most of the staff were nice, the rooms were dated and could use some renovation. There aren't many facilities and the internet in my room cut out once in a while. Overall, a good central location for the price I paid, but I choose another hotel if given the choic again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong With This Hotel, This Visit.”
Reviews.Author: DChiefJim
Reviews.Content: Okay, after I booked here, I read the reviews, some of which were quite disconcerting. Wasn't sure what was going to greet us... However, our stay was more than enjoyable, the room was *impeccably* clean, well-furnished, and except for the plastic glasses provided (just a pet peeve of mine), it was totally acceptable and well worth more than the cheap price ($91.00) we paid for the night - and during the holiday season, no less. The staff was VERY courteous and friendly, and went out of their way to assist us in whatever we required or asked - both the day and night staff. Yes, the parking garage is a bit tight, but humbly, the parking *problem* is more with the driver than the facility. I managed to park a high, extra-length, 1991 GMC Safari XLT quite easily, and get it out very easily - 3 times - from 3 different parking spots, without a hint of hitting anything, thank you very much. If you know how to use your mirrors, it's really quite fine. The tightest aspect is the height, not the turns, or parking space sizes. You do need an extra person on the exterior to guide the driver between the sprinlker system valves to ensure you don't hit them, but ONLY if you have a van or vehicle of that height (6 feet). These days, there's very few of them left. We didn't have time to partake in the restaurant, bar, nor internet access (You need a short ethernet cable or have to request one from the front desk, no Wi-Fi yet), and having the Tim Horton's attached to the hotel was a bonus for that obligatory morning coffee. The hotel still does provide coffee equipment in the rooms, but our timeline precluded that. One reviewer mentioned the noise level from other rooms. It was not a problem for us on the 19th Floor, but honestly, I suspect it was due to the hotel probably being far from full. It could possibly be a problem in the high season, but how bad is subjective to the reviewer. As mentioned, the elevators are all new, and we never had to wait more than a minute for a car at any time - either from the 19th Floor, the Lobby or P1 Parking. The security to and from the parkade is very good as well. There was no evidence of panhandlers out to occost us for money, or any other unsavory characters, and we were out quite late on the 30th. All in all, it was a very nice hotel, we enjoyed our stay, and would stay there again, given the location, price and experience from this stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: artcaviar
Reviews.Content: After my first night, I woke up and was full of bites! Bed bugs. Will never stay here again, worse of all, the Receptionists did not believe me, and refused to change my room. I left the hotel the same day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: fatherspodokomodo
Reviews.Content: I and three friends stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while visiting toronto. We were on a budget and having got our room for dirt cheap we really weren't expecting much! However, we were surprised at how nice the rooms were. We specified a higher floor so had a beautiful view of the Toronto skyline. It was in walking distance to the CN tower (being lazy though we took a taxi) and there was a good range of places to eat in the vicinity. We did not use the hotel's restaurant so I can't comment on that but staff were very helpful and the rooms were clean. It suited us perfectly but if you're looking for the height of luxury, try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown”
Reviews.Author: NicoleS1
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Yonge Street, Hockey Hall of Fame. Subway is within walking distance. Tim Hortons onsite. Staff friendly and helpful. Room serviced daily. Only problem was the carpark was too small. (Coming off the street, the turns were tight and narrow.)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible, terrible. DO NOT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: pink_sar8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a organised bus tour group so didn't have much choice. Being a Best Western i thought it would be ok as all Best Westerns are good. I was so wrong! Upon arrival to the room we found the floor dirty, beds pooly made and mold in the bathroom. Great start but we thought we could deal with it for 2 nights so wouldn't say anything. The next morning the toilet blocked up for no reason. We were also in the 17th floor which caused a issue while waiting 45 minutes for a lift!!! My room mate took the stairs however as i had a ankle injury i was unable to had to wait for the lift. Out of 4 lifts 2 were being used by staff and they wouldn't allow anyone else to get in. When i said something to one of the staff about how i had a ankle injury and couldn't stand for long periods of time she shurgged her shoulders and said 'so'. Very rude staff! When we reported the toilet problem the staff seemed to not care. Once on the bus for the day we heard majority of the other passengers had problems with their rooms, a couple even had to change rooms. No one seemed to be happy. Upon arriving back to the hotel after a full day of sightseeing i waited 40minutes for a lift to go up, got to my room where my key didn't work! I had to wait another 30minutes for a lift to go back down. Then waited 20 minutes at the counter for the lady to help me, only one staff on and she seemed to not want to help me. She told me all cards had been changed and gave me the 2 cards for my room. I asked if she could keep one of the cards for my room mate as she wasn't back and i wanted to go out. She said no and walked away. So i had to then wait for my room mate to come back before i could then go out. Once back in the room i found the floors had not be cleaned, bathroom had not been cleaned but the toilet had been fixed. I didn't encounter one friendly staff member. It is also a very long way from any major attractions or the city centre. Not near any public transport. Also in a really bad part of town, lots of beggers right outside the door and wouldn't leave you alone. Wouldn't go out at night here! This isn't the half of our horrible experience. I'm not going to bore you too much with all the details but this gives you a idea of what it was like. If you want to know more details feel free to message me and i'd be happy to tell you. The tour company i was with actually apologised to us once they heard about all the drama everyone had- all 52 passengers had a problem and complaints. The tour company is even changing the hotel to another one. I recommend not staying at this hotel. Choose another one please!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Sleepy789
Reviews.Content: 1) Rude staff at the front desk (only one of the employees we dealt with were nice); 2) Restaurant only open part of the time; 3) They DID give us a bigger and cheaper parking space out behind the building because our SUV wouldn't fit in the underground parking, but there were junkies hanging around at that parking lot; 3) FOUND A BEDBUG IN THE BATHROOM SINK (ALIVE) -- 'NUFF SAID!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rispectd
Reviews.Content: The staff in the hotel were friendly. The location is really good, we walked 4 blocks to Younge street to go shopping. The only thing that is horrible is the price of parking. We paid $23 a night to park, and it's not even for a full 24hours. The gym facilities are outdated and small. The continental breakfast wasn't free, but there is a good little 24 hour diner a block away. I like the kitchenette in the rooms, it comes in handy when you're staying for a few days. For the quality and location you can't beat the price. I would recommend staying here again if you don't mind being in the gay district.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & price,”
Reviews.Author: SRK4
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night with 2 teenage girls with mom. Location was handy, but late at night was a little intimidating walking the couple of blocks away from the main strip. May have been the time of night, but worth noting. The room was acceptable, given the fact that we spent very little time there, but was a little disappointed with the lack of cleaning, dirty spots in the bathroom, and rather tawdry amenities. Everything seemed to be in need of a little repair, from the sauna, to the toasters at the buffet. Note to anyone staying, if you want parking, arrive early if possible and park in their garage, you don't have to notify them, just find a spot before formal check-in time, and you're set. You can pay for it on checkout, and it gives your fairly cheap parking with access to all downtown attractions. Another glitch, the elevators are small, and you can wait a while, always hit both up & down options when waiting for an elevator, and grab an empty one, even if you have to ride it both ways first!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...That's about it!”
Reviews.Author: kiermel2325
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for weekend away to Toronto with wife and 13 yr old daughter. Drop off point for luggage check in is pretty small so if anyone is in front of you good luck accessing the hotel front door. We waited 25 minutes for a car to move and had to find management to clear it so we could proceed! The "self parking" amenity translates as $23 per night in hotel parking lot! It was full when I got there and had to get a "pass" to park in the employees parking lot in the back alley! This cost $15 a night! The staff member at the desk told us there were "other options" if we didnt want to pay the fee; but didnt let us in on the secret as to where they might be! The laundry left something to be desired. A pillow case had a blood stain on it(I think!), and the the bath towels had yellow stains and smelled "funky"! There was popcorn on the room floor when we arrived? Bath tub water kept leaking out when trying to have a bath. The front desk person was very abrupt and had a serious attitude problem. The room itself was "OK" and the only redeeming factor was the location; which is within walking distance of all major attractions. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: lynnejanet
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Primrose several times over the last few months, and have had generally good experiences. The rooms are reasonably clean, the beds fairly comfortable, and the staff mostly helpful. It is worth noting that the parking garage has very little clearance, and some of the tightest turns I have ever had to negotiate. If you're claustrophobic, you may want to avoid it! The hotel books a lot of bus tours, and some mornings it can take a very long time to get an elevator, because they are being monopolized by the bus tourists, who are all trying to leave at once. Although the front desk staff can be curt, the management are very helpful and accommodating. Very good value for your money, in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “great place!!”
Reviews.Author: blondie014
Reviews.Content: My husband myself and 13 year old son stayed here June 10-13. We stayed in their studio which consisted of 2 beds refrigeraror microwave eating area. It was a very large room for a great price. The hotel was very clean and centrally located. There was a restraunt in the hotel but we never eat there. There is also an outdoor pool on the 3rd floor. We were very pleased with our stay here and would definetly return!!

Reviews.Title: “Primrose was great Value!”
Reviews.Author: flyrobin1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in June for a family wedding, the room was clean staff was friendly and the Tim Hortons coffee was much appreciated. We have another wedding to come to Toronto for in August expect to see us again. Thanks Primrose

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but Front Ofice staff very unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Walaf
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. The room was nice with a very comfortable bed. The storage room next to the lift (17th floor) was constantly kept open with walls quite damaged inside. The gym was a joke as all machines were broken. I chose to go jogging outside and I must say it was great idea. The safe deposit at the reception is placed far from the guest's reach and it is closed and opened by the staff when we placed our valuable items in i which does not give you a safe feel about it. The staff was difficult to deal with and do not make you feel welcome. Another isuue was when the internet in the room was not available for the whole day although it was mentioned to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed and Close to Church Street Village”
Reviews.Author: Christofu
Reviews.Content: My stay was for three days at the Primrose and I found it to be a fine hotel. I attempted to stay there on a subsequent visit to Toronto but found it fully booked unfortunately. For my next visit to Toronto I would hope to be able to stay at the Primrose again. The hotel was clean, modern and the only concern that I had was the limited parking in the hotel garage. I instead parked a block away because the garage was full upon my checking in. Other than that I had a pleasurable stay. I would suggest this hotel if coming to visit the Church Street Village for nightlife and if you wish to visit the rest of the city a subway station is within easy walking distance. The staff were friendly, helpful and the view of the Toronto skyline I had from my room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done on the Changes”
Reviews.Author: M1Classic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last summer and was not impressed at all with the facilities, especially the elevators which were slow, old and in my opinion unsafe. At the time, I voiced my concerns to the management and was told that they were going to be putting in new elevators that fall, and invited me to come back again once they were done. I am quite a well seasoned traveler and since I am not from the city, I assumed that this was just a line they were giving me. I am happy to admit that I was wrong. I was in Toronto last weekend, and so I decided to see for myself if in fact they were telling me the truth about the elevators and the hotel facilities in general. I was quite pleased to see that they were truthful and that all the elevators had been replaced. I did not wait for more than a minute for an elevator at any time I was there, and the insides have been completely remodeled, and look nice, complete with t.vâ€™s inside and announcement of the floor and direction it is going in. So far I was impressed. My mind was once again impressed with the changes they had done in the bedrooms, getting rid of the ugly, stained bedspreads and replacing them with new white duvets and matching curtains and other linens. I thought the room looked much cleaner and nicer, and appreciated the extra touches, like throw pillows and improved coffee and items for the coffee maker. I am usually the last person to admit I was wrong, and based on my last impression of the hotel, I didnâ€™t think I would ever go back, but I was certainly impressed with the changes and will now begin to use the Primrose Hotel again, as my hotel of choice when in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: OnBusiness1
Reviews.Content: I come to Toronto monthly for business and usually like to stay at the Sheraton Centre, but due to a convention they only were offering rooms well above my budget and so I was forced to look for other accommodation in the downtown area. After reviewing the deals which were listed on Travelocity, I selected the Primrose Hotel which is part of the Best Western chain. I initially booked for the price which was great for the downtown area and other then that wasnâ€™t really expecting anything spectacular. I am happy to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel looks like it has undergone some recent renovations in the lobby area, and I noticed that they are redoing the elevators. I was fortunate to ride in one of the new ones and it gave a nice first impression. The room itself was spacious and had everything I needed including free wireless internet (some places I stay at in the US, actually charge you to connect to their internet). The room was clean and fresh looking and had all the standard things in it. The staff were very friendly and helpful in the mornings arranging for taxis. I personally consider this a â€œ great findâ€� as the service and standards were similar to those of the hotel I usually stay at, but the price is much more affordable for those with budgets. On my next trip to Toronto (schedule for April), I will most likely call them first for rooms. I'm coming back in June

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: MadMaxwell
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Toronto and reserved into the Primrose Best Western Hotel on Carlton St. I was given a discount as I was a senior so the price ended up being very reasonable. The hotel was in a good location and was close to restaurants and a wonderful greenhouse which I toured for an entire afternoon. The ladies at the reception desk were very pleasant and always smiling and very helpful in giving us directions. The room I was given had 1 bed and a small sitting area. It was very clean and comfortable and had very nice artwork on the walls. I did have breakfast in the morning in the restaurant beside the lobby area and was pleased with the level of service from the waiter and while he did make a small mistake on my order (he gave me potatoes when I asked for no potatoes), it was quickly rectified, and he continued to provide attentive service. My only complaint would have been that they have a lovely grand piano in the lobby and while I was trying to enjoy my breakfast there was a child playing around on it. I was impressed however that after voicing my concerns, the manager spoke with the parents and the child stopped playing. My stay was a pleasant one, and I would not hesitate to call them for a seniorâ€™s rate again when I next need a place to stay. We really liked this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great beds”
Reviews.Author: CityExplorer78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Primrose for ten days and I did like the beds as well as the location of the hotel. Just a couple of blocks away from Yonge & Dundas Square. It is a great location to explore the city by foot. The room itself was spacious with a king size bed, a sofa, desk, coffee maker (which I did not use), and a chair. I would describe it as typical Best Western standard 3 star hotel quality, nothing special and no frills. What did bother me though was the cleanliness. I did speak to housekeeping and the reception but the somehow they managed not to get the room clean thoroughly. The dust built up in the bathroom and on the carpet was substantial, seriously dust bunnies. Also which was bothersome was the wifi. It was so slow it was practically useless. I did ask if I just could use maybe a land line but no luck.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem in toronto”
Reviews.Author: GaFishman
Reviews.Content: Hidden Gem in Toronto I was in town for a bridal shower and due to its location, stayed at the Primrose Hotel. I had never been there before and was impressed with the level of service I received. The staff were all really nice, but mostly the maid who was nice enough to re-vacuum my room after I checked in because I spilled coffee all over the floor when I was making a pot. The rooms were very nice, and I liked the duvet covers which were very comfy and warm. The free internet was also a nice touch as I am used to paying for internet at other hotels. There was also a coffee shop in the lobby which was very handy. I enjoyed my stay and would certainly recommend it to my friends in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: arabicaAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: On the way up to my room - I got stuck in an elevator. This was a good indication of how my stay was going to be at the hotel. The rooms are old, the bathroom smelled, we had a view of air conditioners and the gym was a joke. No working treadmills and a couple of out of date machines. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: rob_s_way
Reviews.Content: I/we have stayed at the Primrose Hotel 2 â€“ 3 times. We choose the hotel for its proximity to the Gay Village in Toronto (Church and Wellesley area). It is handy to shopping and night life â€“ but so are many other hotels from which to choose. Each time weâ€™ve stayed I have always had the impression that the place needs a good cleaning. It was a little worn down at the edges and maybe has undergone a serious facelift since last we were there. Lord knows that it needed to be done. It appeared to be a well managed facility. Several of the rooms appeared to be rented by students, either from Ryerson or the National Ballet School, both of which are very close. The one good thing that came about from our stays at this hotel was finding The Golden Greek Restaurant which is in the lower part of the building next door. It is a small, friendly, family own/operated business. This restaurant has a loyal group of customers. As someone who visits maybe once every year they remember you â€“ canâ€™t beat that for customer service. The food they serve is good as well. As Iâ€™ve said in the past of other facilities, if you compare this hotel to others of similar value in the same general area, you would choose another establishment. We tried this hotel and will pass on it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “not to impressed”
Reviews.Author: shortyboo2g7
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Primrose Best Western. I must say were all not too impressed. For a downtown Toronto hotel it was not to nice. It remineded me of hotels in the area I am from. Dirty, old, not well kept and very rude workers. When we arrived in our room we found it dirty, the bathroom flooor had not been scrubbed and the bathtub was also dirty. I have stayed in numerous hotels and found that the furniture was not what it should be. usually you have your 2 beds, a couch and table with 2 charis. All we got was our beds, 1 chair and a table. Which the only chair was broken. There were stains all over the wall and windows. We also did not find the customer service up to par. I had gone to the front desk to request more coffee, though I did no you could just call the front desk, but i wanted to get out of the room for a bit. When I arrived at the front desk I felt I was able to approach the lady working. When I asked for more coffee she gave a dirty look and pulled the magazine she was reading off the counter....kinda like I interupted her reading. She then proceeded to ask me my room number. I unfortunately didn't no it...due to stress as to why were there. She then proceeded to ask me what name the room was under which I told her 2 times and she said " I have no one sdtaying here under that name" and looked at as though I shouldn't be there. It took 5 minustes to resolve the room situation and for me to find out that they put our last name in the system incorrecltly. Which I find hard to believe when I know my mom would have spelt in out when we made our reservations and they looked at her credit card when we arrived. After determining that the name was wrong and she corrected it, she then told me she would have the coffee delivered. I asked if I culd just get at the desk. Wow, shouldn't have aked that....my response to this " well we DON"T have coffee, we DON'T keep coffee at the front desk" then she walked away and got on the phone. Upon our day to check out we went to the elevators. We stood and stood and stood some more. During the waiting game we were playing we were stuck with another couple who was checking out. We spoke with them abut there stay and they had the same problems as us. They actually called the head office and were notified that this specific hotel has "mangement problems". All in all it took us 20 minutes to get on the elevator, yes we could have took the stairs but had heavy luggage. It took so long because the hotel service people were on the elevator with their towel cart and delivery towels to every floor. Sorry, but customers first....take your cart off and let us on so we can check out. The real funny thing is they have pictures of there wonderful, tantalizing food restaurant....HAHA it was never open, not the whole time we were there. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: Jason670
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Primrose for one night, mid-week. The price was amazing ($90 CAD) and parking was typical at $23/day/in & out privileges. Check-in was fast and friendly. We had a King bed which was comfy and the pillows were great. The room was dated and the bathroom was the same. The furnishings, lighting, and carpets were nothing fancy. No problems in the bathroom, although the toiletries were pretty cheap. There was a nice sitting area and free wireless access. The pool was closed as it is outdoor and opens in the spring. The only problem was that even with 4 elevators, it was common to wait for a full minute for one. They moved very slow but at least they are undergoing renovation. One of the lifts was renovated and looked great, although it was still as slow as the others. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and offered amazing winter prices. For the low rate, I would return, but if it was any higher I'd probably choose a 4-star hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “A nice play to stay in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JCS276
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Primrose in Toronto several years ago, on an all-guys expedition to Canada. We found it to be a fine hotel, there were 7 of us total, and we had 2 rooms connected. The rooms were spacious with queen sized beds, nice bathrooms, the view was decent out of our 5th floor rooms, and we had no real issues at all as far as the hotel went. There are all manner of things to do, within easy walking distance of Yonge St and the Eaton Centre, the subway is right there, and all kinds of bars and hotspots within easy reach. We found some fun local Canadian girls who showed us around, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The only thing I might mention is the fact that the hotel seems to be located right in the midst of a very prominent gay section of Toronto, and for 7 straight males, some of whom are not particularly tolerant, this could potentially have been problematic. I think everyone of us was taken aback by how open things were in Canada, compared to the States. But it ended up being fine, no issues. Oh I must also add that there is a Tim Horton's donut shop, second only to Dunkin Donuts in quality (although Canadians might argue that point), located right inside the front entrance, so that was a great option for breakfast! All in all, a great place to go for some fun times in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in DT Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jandhabs44
Reviews.Content: I got this reservation off ratestogo.com, for last minute hotel deals. I got it for 90$CAN, so already I was pretty happy for Downtown Toronto. The rooms were great, we were on the 6th floor, beds were comfortable and room was quite clean. Windows opened and we were two smokers so it cleared the air. Walking distance to the Blue Jays game (25 min.). All in all, I`d highly recommend it to anyone looking to catch a baseball weekend, or shop at the Eaton Center and such.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit”
Reviews.Author: chucksterman1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Primrose Hotel for a night after my company's xmas party and was pleasantly surprised. I had never been in the hotel before, but have driven by it numerous times. As it was close to the party, I decided to get a room instead of driving home after. The hotel was very nice and was very festively decorated for the season. The front desk were very nice and they were quick to help me find a cab. There was a big sign in the lobby showing the elevator construction going on, and am happy they are redoing them as the remaining elevators were a bit old and outdated. The room was spacious and clean, and had what I needed, which was basically just a place to sleep. I would not hesitate to recommend to friends who need a place to stay in the city. Good price and service.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay again...”
Reviews.Author: kim3333
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a weekend in Toronto and stayed at the Primrose. i was a little hesitant because of some of the reviews but we were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were very updated and the beds were very comfortable! we stayed on the 15th floor but accidentally went to the 18 floor one day and it was stinky! : smoking floor. As far as the location goes, it was close to everything with maybe a couple of extra short blocks of walking which we didn't mind at all. we did see a couple of homeless guys but they did not bother us. we were joking about not seeing the 'ladies of the night' that we had read about but that was because we were in so early. we did get a craving for some calamari at 12:30 at night so we went out for a walk and saw three girls of the night between our hotel over to Younge. not a big deal. i did not feel threatened at all because of the 'shady area' which was mentioned in some reviews. the subway is just up the street . Bankok Garden on Elm st. is wonderful for Thai. the girl who checked us in was very nice but there was a cranky woman on the next day. the concierge had little knowlege of the restaurants which should be a big part of his job but we made out ok. there are so many wonderful restaurants in toronto including a Korean Grill we went to where you bbq your own meat/fish. it is right on Younge down near Dundas. we will definitely stay here again considering we saved around $100 a night compared to the Delta which we tried to get into but was booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sneakyb
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a great weekend in the big T.O. My friends and I were down for a concert at the Pheonix night club and had a blast. We stayed at the Primrose Hotel as we were told it was close to the concet venue and it was (about $3 a person in cab fare) The hotel was really nice and we were happy to get a larger room which had 2 queen beds instead of 2 doubles. The extra space really helped as there were 3 of us, and we didnt feel so cramped. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. I really liked the whole brown/white colour combos. It looked really slick and modern like. The restaurant was ok. We only ate breakfast there as we had dinner plans, and it was good. It was a buffet which was good as there was lots of selection and the service was fast. The next time we visit TO, we will definately give the Primrose another go.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Changes”
Reviews.Author: wonderwoman1_8
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Toronto and my second time staying at the Primrose Hotel. I stayed there for a conference in 2006 and was surprised at all the changes. They have done some renovations to the lobby area which is now a nice granite counter and some darker woods which look very warm and inviting. I also noticed lots of changes in the rooms. Last time I stayed I made mention of the sheets being very startchy and now they have very comfortable duvets which are much softer. The location is good and it was close to a great Thai food restaurant which I would recommend if you like Thai. The service was good and everyone seemed very friendly and helpful. I would have no problems recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: scan099
Reviews.Content: Location was a little out of the centre but within walking distance. Hotel was clean and staff polite but a litlle overpriced that said it was booked last minute so cant complain. Rooms were very comfortable and free internet access was available.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Fan...but this is not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: teachlaw1
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of Best Western hotels, but this one is not a very good hotel. First the hotel is in a questionable part of town. The park near by attracts a lot of bums, that end up on the steps of the hotel and they are not moved on by hotel management. The parking is costly and very cramped. Our room was on the 14th floor and the elevators were very very slow. While we were there the service elevator was the only one working at one point. The only rude person was the lady who checked us in when we arrived. Everyone else was great. The work out facility is bad. Three of the five machines were broken. The work out facility has been carved out of two rooms that have weight equipment and cardio equipment placed in them. The air conditioning in our room was not good. The thermostat would turn itself up in the middle of the night and it would get hot in the room. So every two hours or so one of us would have to get up and turn down the thermostat. Not a good way to try to get sleep. The resteraunt and bar were never open while we were there. We checked out of the hotel a day early and went around to the Niagara Peninsula. I would not ever stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Little things count!”
Reviews.Author: frenchfryguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Primrose Hotel for years. Simply put Its a clean, well run hotel, with excellent service at the front desk and very large rooms that look great. We are working people with three kids and we dont have a lot of quality time to spend together so when we get the chance we come to the Primrose and here is why: 1) Our favorite room is reserved without us having to ask for it. 2) Our favorite bottle of wine is waiting for us in the room 3) Reservations are made at our favorite restauraunt 4) Staff know us by our first names 5) My wife gets a birthday email on her birthday 6) The staff truly feels like family TRY THIS hOTEL you wont be disapointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it and will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Krystle0819
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night to watch the Rogers Cup. First impression, it was in a decent area, not too far from the central part of downtown with all the restaurants and I thought ok, not too bad. We then checked in and were told that the parking garage was full and that I could park on the street. For me, I believe that if a hotel has a parking garage that it should have adequate space reserved for hotel patrons regardless if they are going to use it or not. Finally, we came back to the hotel at around midnight after seeing the tennis match and having dinner and come to find out that there were hookers on almost every corner surrounding the hotel. After circling the hotel trying to find a parking spot which I eventually did about 1/4 mile from the hotel (on the street), a bum waited in front of my car asking for money. Also, when I booked the hotel I was told that there were only smoking rooms left which was fine because I too smoke, but the smell was almost unbearable. It could have been febreezed, at least. For the price of this hotel, I would imagine a much nicer place in a better area. I do not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Bigshot1
Reviews.Content: Had a stop over in Toronto on my way to Montreal and wound up at the Best Western Primrose Hotel (on Carltone St) Much larger Best Western than I've ever stayed at. Nice lobby. Freindly Staff. Large comfortable room & bed. Great wi-fi service too. Excellent breakfast in the AM as well. Staff was friendly, but not all that sure of area attractions. Location is very central. Wasn't expecting much, but will be going back with the wife next month now.

Reviews.Title: “After mutiple stays at the Primrose and its still a solid choice.”
Reviews.Author: Gottalock
Reviews.Content: I was at the Primrose back in June on the weekend of June 13th - June 15th. It was 2 rooms that were booked as we were 4 guys heading down to T.O to catch some baseball and relax a little. We tarvelled into the city from Ottawa and it is a standard 4 and half to 5 hour drive to get there. Now the parking is insanly difficult to navigate even for the most experienced drivers and the worse garage we have ever parked in but on this certain stay it was full and we parked behind the Days Inn instead. The check in was quick and easy which is standard at most big hotels. We headed to our rooms and were plesently surprised with the many upgrades to the kitchenette rooms we reserved for a dirt cheap $110 per night. The fridge was very large for a bar fridge and the sink set up with oven top is also impressive. The last time we stayed in a room like this it was really drab and the little fridge made so much noise. Good on the Primrose on the renos and allowing it to still be a great deal in downtown Toronto. The beds were comfortable and had ample pillows. The bathroom is pretty standard with a tricky showerhead if not really knowing what your doing. The location is the best part as it is about a 2 blocks from Yonge and the best sports bar in T.O in Hoops. Carleton St is not the nicest at nights as it is littered with the ladies of the night but really its standard in a big city and they leave well enough alone. I would stay again in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jewl03
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, price was decent for Toronto. Within walking distance to downtown, also very close to the Subway, which is very much recommended. Spacious room, comfy bed with a duvet. Clean, quiet. We only stayed for one night and were really only in the hotel to sleep, so we never had a chance to check out everything it offered ie. pool, sauna. There is a Tim Hortons in the lobby which was wonderful in the morning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to Toronto, although it's not downtown, it is well worth the 20 minute walk to save some cash.

Reviews.Title: “Only as a last resort!”
Reviews.Author: LordFader
Reviews.Content: This place needs a makeover in a terrible way. Many items in the room either broken or worn out; desks, lamps, chairs, decorations. Do not get assigned a room at either far end of the hallway if you want to view television; their video cabling is a nightmare that prevents clear signals from propagating correctly. Be prepared to wait a long time for your server to appear/re-appear if you're dining in the onsite restaurant... horribly understaffed with inept and unattentive waiters. That is when the restaurant/bar is actually open! It's only open for lunch or dinner from 5:00 - 10:00 PM on Thursday through Sunday; Monday - Wednesday you're out of luck. Breakfast only starts at 7:00 AM but does seem to be available 7 days a week. The small fitness center hadn't seen a vacuum in a very long time as was the case with the 3rd floor swimming pool. Several unidentified floating objects were the only things keeping the pool company! All in all, a dingy, dirty, tired old hotel in need of a wrecking ball and a fresh start. As the title says, select this if you have a need for a one-night layover when all you need is a bed and a shower... those were actually OK.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: tinytree
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with my g/friends , we had a great time, the rooms were clean and also the bathrooms. the restaurtant served an excellent breakfast, the front desk staff was excellent and very courteous, it was close all the bars, clubs and the concert. we will be coming again during the summer. .

Reviews.Title: “It could have been worse.”
Reviews.Author: LeighT83
Reviews.Content: This was certainly not the greatest hotel I have ever stayed in. I picked it because it was three stars, had internet access, and was stumbling distance from the concert two of us were attending. I booked a single room with two beds for the four of us and it was acceptable. Well, with the exception of the bathroom. It was small and not very clean. The staff were rude and quite useless, they just seemed annoyed and unwilling to help no matter how polite we were. Which made it easy to stumble through the lobby drunk and singing at 1:00 a.m. There was a 'restaurant' that never did open the three days, two nights we stayed and no room service. None of the 'perks' of the hotel were available-pool, steam room, gym, and the TV was old and hardly worked. The room we payed for with internet access, didn't have internet access. They at least lent us an external wifi card but it still didn't work. And they never did give us any form of refund for that either. There were 'ladies of the night' out front of the hotel, but they were harmless and didn't hassle us at all. I had a great time, as did my other friend. But that was due to the amount of rum we consumed and an amazing concert. I don't feel our two friends enjoyed the stay as much as we did. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as the Reviews Indicated”
Reviews.Author: bookperson
Reviews.Content: While I'd agree that the parking garage was hard to manoevre and the elevators were slow, that's as far as the negative experiences I had at this hotel went. From the time we got our parking permit until the time we checked out we had nothing but polite staff. The parking attendant was pleasant, the check in went smoothly,the room and the view was terrific. The sheets and the bathroom were impeccable and the stay was great. The restaurant buffet for breakfast was good, the wait staff was very pleasant. At check out the couple ahead of me had a bad experience with the management but the young fellow at the desk handled it with such grace that I wanted to applaud him. Everything on our bill was as it should be and the checkout went smoothly. It's not in the best part of Toronto but for the price and amenities it was a great value. My family has said that we should return at some other time.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff and run down rooms”
Reviews.Author: sixsevendc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Primrose Toronto for New Years weekend 2007. I had stayed at this hotel in the past but this time it seemed the hotel was run down. We checked in only to find that the agent had us down for one night and not three that was corrected from what I was told. Our Room was big but old. The beds were sagging and the bathroom had mildew in the bath tub and paint coming off the walls. At check out on New Years day 1/1/08 I checked out bill only to find out that they charged us incorrectly and I tried to explain to Allan the front desk agent that I had a writen confirmation he didn't care, He made it out to seem that I was lying and he keep saying deal with my manager later not GOOD. After proving I was correct and they were wrong it was fixed but didn't need to experence this. If you want a good 2 1/2 star hotel stay at the Days Inn two blocks up or the Courtyard by Marriott 4 blocks way.

Reviews.Title: “A choice of last resort.”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I had to stay an extra night in Toronto and found that my existing hotel (Sheraton Centre) was sold out for the Monday so I had to make a last minute reservation at another hotel. As Toronto was heavily booked up for the evening, I had to stay at the Best Western Primrose, and I was happy it was only for a single night. The hotel is not in a nice area of the city and you will notice a great deal of sketchy personalities roaming the streets around the area. I did not trust the underground parking facilities so made sure to bring all my bags and valuables up to my room. The Primrose is a dated property offering only basic levels of service. Check in went smoothly and there was no valet on duty to help with our bags, so we brought them up ourselves using one of the baggage carts. The elevators are very small, so getting a cart and two bodies into the tight space was a difficult. The room is pretty much the same quality as the rest of the hotel and was definately a 1 to 2 star experience. We slept soundly and checked out early the next morning. There is a decent diner to the left of the hotel and a great little Thai restaurant on the other side and around the corner. The hotel had a restaurant but it looked to be closed when we went to eat. The rest of the area I would not trust to walk alone at night and there is not a great deal to do other than take a taxi west where the true city begins.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: mjm-one
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Primrose this month. Granted the area is on the seedy side but the hotel was much better than expected. Our room was spacious and clean. Staff was friendly and efficient. The subway and public transportation was convenient and there were sufficient restaurants in the area. The biggest complaint would be the elevators. They were very slow. We happen to be in Toronto during the Grey Cup so there was lots of noise at night in the hotel. I would stay here again and would recommend it to everyone looking for a clean, conveniently located budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: matty75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Primrose last weekend with a buddy for the Grey Cup and had a blast. The hotel was great and the people at the front desk were awesome. We were a little late getting up after the game and they let us stay longer past check out time without getting charged extra. The room was alot bigger then most hotels i have stayed in and I liked the fact that they had duvets instead of the typical stiff sheets most places do. The parking garage was a little tight to drive around in, but other than that, I would definately go back for another weekend with the guys. Everyone was really nice and helpful when we needed to get directions. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tough parking”
Reviews.Author: gunners165
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. The hotel charges $23 for parking, which should be free considering the difficulty it is to get into an actual parking spot. If you have a van or larger vehicle forget parking here. The ramps are very steep, the spots are narrow and the driving room is almost non-existent. You have to drive very slow and carefully to make sure you don't damage your car. The elevators are very small, it is cramped with 4 people with luggage. To get to the parking lot from the guest floors you will need to use an access card in the elevators; if you are not quick enough, or your card doesn't work properly, you will find that you are called to another floor. If you get on an elevator that is packed, forget about getting to the card reader. The room rates are high considering the age/look of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NASTY, DO NOT GO!!”
Reviews.Author: Beckwith2
Reviews.Content: I booked the â€œPrimroseâ€� Best Western, downtown Toronto a few days ago for a trip that we had planned. We arrived at 3:00 in the morning, and drove through the night to arrive to the filthiest hotel we have ever seen! Not knowing much about hotels in Toronto, and trusting the name â€œBest Westernâ€�, we decided to save a few dollars and book online. While taking an elevator to our room, we noted the bottom of the elevator was being held together with a piece of plywood. Exhausted, we walked into our room, and experienced the most overwhelming foul smells, I canâ€™t even describe! My husband laughed when he saw the conditions of the bathroom. A bathtub so filthy I wouldnâ€™t dare stand to take a shower. Weâ€™ve travelled to some very poor countries in our lives, but weâ€™ve never seen such dirty conditions! The room was so filthy, we decided to leave, and find another hotel. We didnâ€™t realize that the Primrose Best Western hotel was in the middle of a large prostitution area, until we left and noticed the building was surrounded by dozens of prostitutes. When we arrived at the Hilton (which we really couldnâ€™t afford, but were tired and in desperate need of a clean place to stay), staff noted that â€œThe Primroseâ€� Best Western was know for their bedbugs!!! Sure enough, when we returned to Ottawa, a Google search revealed that they indeed they had bedbug problems years ago!!! I am a nurse from Ottawa, and basic cleanliness is my only must for a hotel. PLEASE, save yourself the bother, spend the extra few dollars, and go to a reputable hotel!!! Please see bedbugs: [--]

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Nasty Nasty”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: OK, the bed and pillows were GREAT! That ends the positive stuff. Once you were off the bed it was a filty nasty hellhole. Stuck in the creepy elevator on the 22 floor. That was scary. The carpet was NASTY. The decor outdated. the amenities SPARCE, with ice and vending only on two floors in a 24 floor tower. The wireless internet worked "sometimes" and more often not. But wait! There is more! The neighborhood was as filthy as the hotel. I have stayed all over the world. This was the WORST. I have more to say, but I am not sure I can post it. Aweful, aweful, aweful. These people who liked it must not get out much.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a convenient location and a great view”
Reviews.Author: 1worldview
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned after a 5 day trip to Toronto. We stayed at this hotel throughout our stay in Canada. We got a large room with two double beds and a coffee maker. The best thing about the room was its view. We had a breathtaking view of downtown Toronto second only to the CN Tower view. We arrived late well past the check-in time and were worried about getting a good room. The hotel staff were very courteous and even asked if we needed a smoking or a non smoking room and a room with two double beds or one. We picked a non smoking room with two double beds.There are several restaurants in this area. The College St subway stop is only a few blocks away. Dunbar Sq is within walking distance. Several churches of different denominations are dotted around Allan Park that is across the street. And when you are at the park don't forget to visit the Greenhouse. It is free. For the price we paid for this hotel and the round trip airfare booked through Travelocity, it was a steal. Joe Daniel, New York, NY

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dojo01
Reviews.Content: The location was fine , just 3 or 4 blocks from Yonge St. where there are a lot of restaurants.I would like to say, that the front desk staff, wasnÂ´t very attentive, they could try harder. PROS: The room was big , that was great and also had a kitchen and a refrigerator. CONS: The room needed some maintenance , specially the bathroom, when you opened the tap it made a terrible noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price. Don't let the trashing here fool you.”
Reviews.Author: TobyAtWork
Reviews.Content: The day before I checked in to this Best Western I read the reviews on here and freaked out! I was actually scared to the point I told my boss I didn't want to stay there. I would have switched hotels but a co-worker was already there. When I checked in I didn't see anything that put me off that much? Lobby seemed nice, there's a restaurant right off the lobby that is also very nice and the Tim Horton's attached to the hotel is a great perk for me (I need my Tim's coffee in the AM!). I did notice the elevators seemed dated and in need of an update, but given that I was on high alert, this wasn't a big deal. When I got to my room I was impressed. Large room, with really nice and comfy duvets, and overall much nicer than I've seen from most hotels in Toronto in this price range. Room and furnishings were in good shape and overall I was very impressed given I was expecting a horror show. Housekeeping and front desk staff were all very nice and friendly. Found my room and the hotel in general very clean and well kept. Hotel has free wireless internet that I used in my room and in the Lobby that worked well. The hotel is was a 15min. walk to the Eaton Center. One of the nicest Best Western's I've been to. I'll be back. Took some pics on my cam phone of our two rooms and the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Please read, detailed review - Primrose is fine”
Reviews.Author: Lederfrau
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 2-3 star depending on what reviews you read. I was concerned when I saw the pictures and read the reviews of this hotel. Check in was quick and it was a busy long weekend in Toronto. Staff will ask if you want smoking or non, and king or two double during checkin. Ask for a high floor. I forgot to ask but noticed we were on a high floor when handed the pass cards for our room. There are smoking and non-smoking floors. We were on the 17th with a beautiful view of the city. There is a pool on the third floor, we didn't go down but people were using it. Staff are friendly and take the time to explain how to find parking etc. The underground hotel parking is now $23. The lot was full and we safely parked at Wood and Church in a city lot for $15. It is less than that if you are leaving by 6 am. There are two more parking lots just south of the hotel on either side of the street but wanted $30 for the night. A note about parking anywhere in Toronto - park by one of the lights, remove anything that is visible from your car. This includes face plate from your stereo, CDs. Keep your car clean and nobody will be interested. I have included a picture of the bedroom and the bathroom. The room was clean and well maintained. If I had to take a guess I'd say that it was renovated in the past year or two. The bedroom was furnished with a king size bed, two spacious bedside tables with lamps, a large 6 drawer dresser, tv with many cable channels, work desk with executive style chair, clean sofa with a pull out bed, several lamps and and a table with two chairs near the window. The front hall has a closet on one side and the other is a large mirror and the bathroom. Wireless internet is available in all rooms. I am not sure what the "crunchy" bed comment was about in previous reviews. It was a regular spring coil mattress. Air conditioning worked great and cooled the room fast. Also in the bedroom was a coffee maker, sealed take away coffee cups, two coffee mugs, 1 packet each of ground decaf and regular coffee, name brand tea, and little packs with sugar, sweetner, coffee whitener, and a stir stick. The bathroom was bright and clean. The floor tiles were a bit older compared to the new ones in the shower but still clean. The toilet, sink and shower were all clean as well. Plenty of fresh towels etc. Also in the bathroom was an ice bucket and plastic cups in sealed bags. The bathroom basket had two bars of soap, shower cap, brand name lotion, conditioning shampoo, mouthwash, and a sewing kit. Elevators are slow, if you know this in advance you will be fine. Look at the sign in the elevator to note which floors have ice machines. When the elevator doors opened on lower floors (we saw 6 & 4) I could see that the carpets were not as new looking as the ones on our floor. I expect that renovating a place of this size takes a few years. There is a Tim Hortons downstairs if that is your thing. There are restaurants all over, it is downtown Toronto. There is a Golden Griddle a few short blocks west of the hotel by the subway. I need to make a comment about the night life because of previous comments about this hotel. I was looking out so that I could comment for this review and I did see two hookers. Two hookers is not shocking stuff. They are not going to hurt you. It is downtown Toronto, and they are everywhere if you open your eyes. Do not freak out, there are also lot of police because...wait for it...yes, you guess it, because it is downtown Toronto. There is no reason to be afraid walking in the neighbourhood. This hotel is very close to the Village area and a quick walk to the subway or streetcars. I have been at many hotels and for the price this is a fine place and I would stay again. For a downtown Toronto hotel that is not a boutique hotel it is above average. You will be paying less than half the price of a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Best Western Primrose”
Reviews.Author: macbreen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for several nights in June, and were very disappointed. We had made our travel arrangements through Orbitz and didn't know how to cancel part-way through the stay, which is the only reason we didn't check out early. The first night there was no parking garage spot available, so we parked were the hotel recommended. Our car was broken into. The next day when we moved into the garage the attendant said we should never have parked in the previous location because everyone should know that your car would be a target there. The front desk staff were very unfriendly and always seemed to make matters overly complicated. They also didn't all have the same procedures. For instance one staff member refused to believe that another staff member had run our credit card through for a $300.00 account hold for incidentals until I showed him a copy of the receipt. He argued with me that they would only have gotten a $100.00 hold because that was their policy. They also tried to charge me with an extra night's garage parking and I had to get a manager involved to avoid the extra night's charge. I couldn't believe they were trying to stick me for a charge when I hadn't been able to park in the garage, the spot was supposed to be free, the spot was recommended by the hotel staff, AND my car was broken into while parked there. Also, the hotel is a high rise with only a few elevators which the staff also use. The elevators are VERY SLOW and we routinely spent several minutes waiting for them. The staff made no effort to give guests priority on them, either.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a dump.”
Reviews.Author: tyko2000
Reviews.Content: I was not put at ease by the housekeeper on our floor. I told her I didn't want my room cleaned and came back to find she had been inside the bathroom (but didn't make the bed?). Then the next day, she saw me knocking on the door to my sister's room and let me in when no one answered!!! But I left cash in my briefcase and it was fine, so who knows? Restaurant breakfast is disgusting. Walk down the block (Jarvis) to Sunrise Cafe, good breakfast and cheaper. The menu doesn't say so, but it seemed any egg or omellete dish came with toast, hashbrowns and pancakes (but pancakes were gross). Great location, in my opinion. My sister and I never felt unsafe in the area. Have the other reviewers never encountered homeless people before? Ignore them when they talk to you or say no. The hotel is really old and needs renovation. The furnishings in the rooms desperately need to be replaced, but seemed clean. We had two rooms on the 20th floor, and I think the bathrooms must have been renovated, they seemed much newer than anything else. Both sides of the hotel (on higher floors at least) have very good views! Elevators were scary, we were worried we'd get stuck. But all four are functional, and although the hotel was full for Pride, we never had to wait too long for one. Parking garage has very tight turns so be careful. You could see chunks out of the pillars and walls where people run into them.

Reviews.Title: “Completely God-awful”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGuy44
Reviews.Content: I just want to add my comments here. I was just on a business trip and because of circumstances had to stay at the Primrose for one night before I came back to the States. It was gay pride week so very few rooms were available and I had to take a smoking room here at this God-awful place. I've stayed in many places around the world but this was the worst. You felt as if you needed a shower just being in the hotel. It is very worn and in a terrible area of town. Nothing in the room felt clean and I agree with one reviewer that the bed "crunched". I could not believe what they charged for a room at this hell-hole, and it is funny just around the corner from the building is a "back-packer's hostel which I thought would have been much better than this dump. Heed this warning stay away from this crappy place, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more to get a lot more!”
Reviews.Author: marklondon007
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Primrose Hill is in dire need of a face lift, it does however fit inf or the area it is in. While being pretty close to the university and Maple Leaf Gardens, the area is dominated by the homeless and prostitutes. We booked one of their junior suites, being that we were staying for 4 nights and thought we could cook our own food a couple of nights to save a bit of money, but even though they supply a cooker and microwave, they don't supply any pots, pans or utensils!? We did cook one night using the grill, and it was so smokey from not being cleaned previously that it set off the smoke alarm! luckily only the in room one and not the one connected to the whole building. As most people have already noted that the lifts are very slow, and the whole hotel has a musty and or bleach smell. The bathrooms are tired and need to have the tiles replaced, or at least thoroughly cleaned to remove the mould stains. I would recomend either staying at a hostel or spending the $10 extra to stay at some of the nicer hotels down near the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “do not use the lifts/elevators - The 'Worst' Best Western hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexPalin
Reviews.Content: We were tipped off that the lifts in this hotel are terrible before our arrival as we were on a tour. But we didnt realise they were as bad as they were, on the 3rd time of using them we got stuck!!
