Afterwards the Manager acknowledged that the lifts are in need of urgent replacement but due to the cost this has yet to be authorised. In the meantime people get stuck very often in seems. Indeed afterwards we saw on many occasions out of order signs on the doors at various times. We never used the lifts again after being moved to a lower floor. Atleast the manger moved us promptly but he's probably used to this request by now. Other than the hotel is OK, but far from great. The rooms are tired with many defects (both my rooms had faults including bulbs out, loose headboard and loose bathroom fittings. Breakfast was fairly average too. PS The hotel is right next to the redlight district too!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Use the Safety Deposit Boxes at this Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: StraightShooter60
Reviews.Content: I would like to advise anyone staying at this hotel not to use their front counter safety deposit boxes. They have a rather primitive system of giving you a box without a key for you to put your valuables into and hand back to the front desk clerk. The clerk then places your box under the counter and then hands you a key which supposedly is the only key to that box. The problem is you do not see where your box is being placed and how it is secured. $2000.00 was stolen for me last weekend because I trusted this obviously poor safety deposit system. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “I Am So Scared, The Best Western Primrose Will Always Haunt Me...”
Reviews.Author: Daman1992
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a second time, on a Tour of the Eastern US & Canada. This was by far, the worst hotel on the tour, and the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. We arrived late in the night and were told that this hotel was in the most dangerous area of Toronto. Great way to start the night. We went up the slow elevators to our room and it wasn't that great. We had a nice view of the CN Tower though. It was quite spartan, and the maid had done a relatively good job cleaning. The room was looking quite old, however, and the entire hotel is in desperate need of repair. We left for the Eaton Ctr, which is about 1/2 mile from the hotel. There were homeless people and mental cases yelling and screaming at us. We were even followed. Took a taxi back to the hotel, too scared to walk. We went up to our room to get a nights sleep, but we went one level down to get some ice for the water. The machine was very loud and took some time to get the ice out. After getting the ice we waited for the elevator. The elevator is about the scariest part of the hotel. It is so slow and usually breaks down, though we never got stuck. We waited about 15 minutes for the lift. The lobby is very dark and I was having fears that a boogieman would come around the corner and hurt us. Also, one of the lifts had broken down, with people in it, we could hear the alarm ringing. So, so freaky. We finally got a lift and went to our room. The next morning it took 20 minutes in the lift to get down, including wait time. We stopped at about 5 floors, and it was full from just the four of us in it. No-one else could fit. We stopped by at the Tim Horton's which is inside the hotel and picked up a coffee and cakes from the surly staff. And this all occurred on my birthday. Never again, will I stay at the Best Western Primrose.

Reviews.Title: “It has some good points”
Reviews.Author: maytravels8
Reviews.Content: Well, it has some good points, and some that are not so good. It is an old hotel that is in desperate need of renovations. The elevators are tiny, and scary rickety. Some of the staff wouldn't know which way was up if you showed them, and the bed crunches when you lay down. It is as if the mattress is filled with packing peanuts. The most interesting part I have to say was when I was leaving and there was almost a fight between the taxi drivers. It turns out the doorman was trying to rip me off by putting my stuff not in the private company I ordered but into a car driven by someone who would give him a payoff. The location is great though. It is about 2 blocks from the College Station subway, and you can get anywhere. In all it wasn't all that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: WillieMakeit
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst experiences I have ever with a hotel room that cost $160 a night. The elevators were very scary and one was constantly being repaired. When at the restaurant, they gave me catchup that was so rancid it bubbled. There was brown stuff on the walls of the bathroom, and the room was very shabby. It was either too hot or too cold. For $10 extra I could have stayed at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm, It was okay, I guess”
Reviews.Author: rdr49
Reviews.Content: My wife had a review course in downtown Toronto on Saturday. We were going to arrive in Toronto late on Friday evening and only be in the room about 12 hours, so we (she) decided to go the economy route. The hotel was listed on Hotwire.com as a 2.5 star property at $53 USF. We ended up paying $75.20 CDN (with taxes) for the room with an addition $15 CDN for underground parking. That is a pretty good rate for a downtown name-brand hotel on a weekend night in March. The hotel is located 500 metres east of Yonge Street (the main north-south street in Toronto) and it is a 5 -10 minute walk to the subway in good weather. The hotel is easy to spot while driving towards it and there is a tight but convenient front driveway off Carlton Street for checking-in. We found the check-in staff to be courteous. The underground parking garage has tight corners and steep ramps and parking down there is an exercise in very careful manoeuvring. The elevators have been criticized in previous reviews. There are 4 of them. They are small and tending towards being a little shabby. We were up and down 6 times but never had to wait more than 40 seconds for a car. Our room was placarded â€œnon-smokingâ€� but when we entered, it smelled musty and it seemed like there might have been a smoker or smokers in there in the recent past. The room was equipped with a microwave (partially clean), a fridge, an iron and ironing board, and TV. The mattress was okay but not as good as the one we have at home. The room was generally clean although the upper closet shelf, the tops of picture frames, and the top microwave shelf were dusty. The bathroom was okay but it was â€œun-renovatedâ€� with old bathroom tiles and grouting that had a 1950's look. Apparently the hotel rents out rooms on the lower floors as part of a student residence program. When we returned from a late evening walk, we found the lobby to be crowded with students and 4 or 5 bicycles they had brought in off the slushy streets right onto the lobby carpet. Call me stuck-up, but they lowered the tone of the place. The maintenance and parking staff we talked to the next morning were quite friendly and helpful. Checkout is 11:00 am from the room, and 14:00 from the garage. I think we got reasonably good value for our money. This hotel would appeal to budget travellers who do not have high expectations of luxury at low prices. We would return there if we could get the same rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: boldmoves
Reviews.Content: We just came back from this hotel. The property was much better then I expected. The staff was very polite, rooms were clean, and the hotel has a great location. We listened to advices from previous reviews and asked for a room on one of the higher floors. We were given a room on the 12th floor with a south view so we had a view of downtown, CN Tower, and Lake Ontario. As I mentioned before, the room was clean. Very comfortable bed, a small kitchenette in the room (coffee maker, microwave oven, and a refrigerator). The location of the hotel is not too far away from the College Subway station. It comes very useful if you don't want to drive in downtown. The station is about 300 yards west of the hotel. Since I metioned driving, I must mention parking in the hotel. By the time we arrived, all parking spots at the hotel were taken. We were advised to park our car about 2 blocks away where there were no "in and out" priviledges. This is why we used subway frequently. Also, the hotel parking has a height limit of 6 feet, so, since we were driving a GMC Yukon, it was not available to us anyway. Another inconvenience to us was Tim Hortons located on the hotel premises. This is not to complain about Tim Hortons in any way, but were were dissapointed of the "limited" menu they have had there. We are huge fans of their breakfast menu but there were only a few choices available- very few muffins and bagels. No Breakfast sandwiches for meat lovers like myself. Again, this is in no way to complain about the quality of service or Tim Hortons, just heads up for fellow travellers. The elevators are a little slow as some other reviews indicated. It was not a big problem going up but it took us about 5 minutes or so when we wanted to go down.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy.”
Reviews.Author: americancat2006
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the BW Primrose in early october. Stayed in a king bed room on the 17th floor. Room was large and clean, bathroom was nice, looks like it was newly renovated. Our room had a south view of the city with a fantistic view of downtown and the lake. The staff was really nice and helpful and directed me to the nearest tourist attractions. The underground parking in the hotel was $15 a day, but you do get in/out privileges, just use caution when parking, it's a bit tight down there. The Internet was complimentary(wireless) made it convienent to check my email from my room. Overall, a great place to stay because the rooms were clean, staff was friendly and helpful, many attractions and great restaurants are walking distance from the hotel. If your looking to come to Toronto leave the Car at home. The Hotel is in walking distance to most major attractions and the public transportation is easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: annie130
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights during a tour, and was so disappointed by this hotel. The lifts? Forget it. I thought I was lucky being on a low floor as crowds waited, until I got to my room. It had a tiny strip window near the ceiling, with torn netting outside, and when I climbed on the filthy settee I saw I was next to the dilapidated looking pool area. My room also housed the alarm system control box, that flashed constantly. The room was really grubby - the furniture and carpet were dirty - and my bed (I was travelling solo) was smaller than a uk double and rock hard. The bathroom was grubby and in need of renovation. I know this hotel runs a student housing programme - I obviously had one of the rooms they normally use for it. The only good thing about this hotel for me was its position - you can walk to most of what you want to see in Toronto, or it's cose to the subway. But if they can't guarantee you a high floor - and remember the dreadful lifts! - I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Student residence program but has some info to help tourists.”
Reviews.Author: 0range
Reviews.Content: I am participating in the student residence program and my first thought was that it would be awsome living in a hotel. Well I was wrong. My room connects with another room and you can hear the neighbour's television blasting and their conversations. One night I had the unfortunateness of hearing my neighbour's "good time" if you get my drift. The food is god awful, my stomach had to get used to it. The laundry facilitys are in poor quality. There are only four washers and one is always "out of service". A woman at the front desk is the rudest person i have ever met. The elevators are super slow. I do not recomemnd taking the elevators in the morning if you are only a few flights from the main floor because people are sardined in the elevator please take the stairs. Also I think there is a private school also staying in the hotel because there are little kids in uniforms screaming about. The bathroom has mold on the ceiling and the toilet paper is like tissue paper. There are stains on my bed and it's literally sleeping on a gym mat in student residence. The room thermostat doesn't stay the same temperature. When you turn it down and gradually goes up and if you can sleep only when it's a cool temperature you are going to have to wake up in the middle of the night to turn down the thermostat again. So if you are coming to Primose hotel I would recommend coming during may through august because that's when all the college students and noise is gone. I think they should use the money that they have ripped off people and take some time to fix up their hotel. Also,if you are planing to stay here for student residence don't make it your first choice, please look around maybe stay in a dorm or something.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied for the Price”
Reviews.Author: parker-scanlon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel the last week in August. We were very pleased with our choice. It's close to the subway and one day we walked to the CN tower - didn't realize it was that close. If you are in good shape, walking will get you to all the downtown attractions. The room was nice and very comfortable. I found the hotel staff very friendly and accomodating. One thing to mention - there are a number of prostitutes that work between the hotel and the subway station, so if you walk home at night you will run across them. But really that was not a big problem, they minded their own business.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of Fresh Air.”
Reviews.Author: Rachelshouse
Reviews.Content: Very close to all major downtown districts. Super fast high speed Interntt. Love the Goosedown Duvet and Curved Shower Rod. Friendly service and attentive staff. I will make more reservations in 2007. Thanks Primrose.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gstq80
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers are saying, the place needs a facelift fast. Some hospitality training for the staff wouldn't be too much to ask either. A couple of my friends and I stayed there for a weekend of fun and it was awful from the start. Mind you, we were all college age guys, not too concerned about what the place looked like. But from the time they told us we had to go get public parking down the street, to mixed up room arrangement, through just rude service, and a tile falling from the bathroom wall, the price was not worth it. The only thing this place has going for it is the location close to the bars and clubs (which might be a minus if you don't want to risk running into prostitutes on your walk back from dinner). Reading some of the good reviews posted it seems we stayed at different hotels. But if you're thinking of staying at this one, pass it up.

Reviews.Title: “Scary parking, sensor controlled air conditioning, Beware of Elevator!”
Reviews.Author: MarlaB
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend trip to Toronto from July 21-24 and stayed at the Best Western Primrose. Despite some of the other disappointing reviews, my choices were limited due to finances and hotel availability. I will first start with the parking issue. I know Toronto is a big city with lots of people but if a hotel has its own parking structure, there should be enough room for the guests. However the garage was full forcing us to park two blocks away and carry our luggage to the hotel. I thought the clerk was doing us a favor when she offered us privileges to the 'employee' parking lot for $15 a day. That is the same price as the parking structure and actually cheaper than the lots around the hotel. We figured it would be safer as well. Since the structure was full and I read other reviews that it was difficult to maneuver an SUV through the tiny twists and turns, we took the offer. However, the employee lot turned out to be a complete joke. It was down a short alleyway and the tight turn to get into the lot required me to get out of the vehicle and guide my brother into a space. The lot was extremely small as well. No way could all the employees fit in this lot. Plus, there are bums/homeless people sitting on the curbs which made me uncomfortable. Another minor problem was the air conditioning unit. We set it at the lowest temperature but it was always so hot in the room. I called for help but it was still hot in there the next day. We were told that all the units had a motion sensor on them and that when there was no movement, the unit reset itself to 74 degrees. Well, one night we rushed in and checked the unit and what actually happens is that the unit totally shuts off and resets itself to 74 after you enter the room. So all day long while you are out the air is off and it takes forever for it to cool down especially in the July heat. Now onto the REAL problem with the hotel and that is the elevator issue. 90% of the time we tried to use the elevator there was at least a 5 minute wait just to get on. They did not sound safe either. They made this horrible noise and the 16th floor elevators did not show you what floor the elevator was on so it was a guessing game. Once after waiting about 5 minutes, I challenged my brother to a 'game'. I took the stairs 16 flights down while he waited for the elevator. I beat him by 5 minutes! Saturday morning I questioned this problem with the staff and they reassured me that the maintenance person fixed the elevators. Saturday night at 10:45pm my brother and I were stuck in the elevators for 15 minutes along with about 9 other people. We called for help and followed the directions but nothing was working. People were scared and HOT. Then we called again and the lady could not hear us, thus losing connection. Talk about scary! Finally after stopping at just about every floor, it stopped and the doors opened on floor 19. Boy was I furious. Upon checking out, I spoke to the manager and expressed my dissatisfaction especially after being reassured everything was fine. The manager tried to tell me some story how it was a busy weekend and kids were messing with the elevators, etc. but I knew better. A woman and her elderly father next to us were also complaining because he also got stuck in an elevator and the couple on the other side of us were complaining of the long wait. The manager was only going to credit me for one day of parking but that was not good enough for me. He finally credited me for all 3 days of parking and I couldn't get out of there fast enough. I tried to be moved to a room closer to the ground level but they were booked. I would advise you to also ask if you are planning on staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Shabby....”
Reviews.Author: Clmmo
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Toronto for a 6 day vacation. We actually switched hotels from a different one to the Primrose, and I do have to say it was satisfactory for my needs. I read reviews up to a year ago about this hotel and found them all to be very mixed, and I would have to disagree with the negative half of them. I am 20 years old so my expectations might be a bit different than someone older. The hotel is in the homosexual part of your town, so if that bothers you, pick somewhere else. The only really bad part of the hotel was the parking ramp and the elevators. The elevators were so slow, be prepared to wait between 7 and 10 minutes to get the elevator to stop at your floor, and if it's not already full, you can go to the lobby. In fact, these are so bad, 2 of the people I went on vacation with were stuck in the elevator for nearly 10 minutes becasue the door wouldn't open. The parking ramp is terribly small, with an entrance hill of about 50 degrees...I wouldn't make the mistake of stopping on it like I did, you might not be able to get up the hill. The corners are very, very sharp, and the parking spaces are tight...don't attempt to get anything bigger than a Ford Taurus in there, casue it won't happen. Check in is at 3:00 PM, and I suggest if you want a parking space you get there very early becasue parking is on first come first serve basis, and there are only 78 spots for a 100 plus room hotel building. The first night we were there and we parked in a run down, ghetto lot on Church street for 20 bucks. The service at the front desk could have been a bit friendlier, but it's not that big of a deal. Other than that, everything else was awesome, the rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable and clean, bathrooms clean and spacious, the view of Carlton/College street is amazing, cleaning service did a good job, the bar is good, and the location is pretty decent. There are a few hookers at night if that's your thing. The toronto area has many restaurants and shops within walking distance. All in all if you are looking for a decent, cheap stay in a beautiful city, you've got the right place, it's no 5 star hotel, but it surly did the job for what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal”
Reviews.Author: AShoemaker
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for a small conference, and overall we were disappointed. The rooms were of reasonable size, and we did have a decent view of the city. However, the sheets had some stains, the bathroom was rundown, and the air conditioner was terribly loud. Of course, the windows didn't open so we had to choose between noisy and stuffy when trying to sleep. It would have been acceptable for a truly budget hotel, but not at over $150 / night. The elevators were scary -- on several occasions, they would rise a foot or so while the doors were still open and people were getting in and out. The staff was mixed. They seemed generally pleasant and friendly, but they didn't seem to care much about the hotels problems either. The hotel had a small gift shop, but it was closed much of the time we were there. The one positive was the location -- we were a fairly short walk from a number of places to eat, shop, dance, etc. -- though also near many women "working" the streets at night. The room we had included a very small, basic kitchenette, which might be convenient for some people.

Reviews.Title: “It's not so bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price ($70 USD on Priceline) I was pleasantly surprised for what I got. Nice, clean, basic rooms, decent little kitchenette, sufficient bathrooms, and reserved parking space in the parking garage. The key is the location. Two blocks from the college subway station which is at most a 5 minute subway ride to just about anywhere in town. A little supermarket called Rabba Market is down the street and has a decent selection for a downtown marketplace. An internet cafe is around the corner if you didn't bring a laptop with you to take advantage of Primrose's free wireless access. There were also negatives. The biggy for me was the parking garage. I had a heck of a time trying to navigate my Ford Taurus through the narrow driving path through the garage. Thankfully, I made it without dinging up my car, but by looking at the walls, you can tell many weren't quite as lucky as multicolored streaks lined the white walls where cars grinded against them. If you have a Chevy Suburban or similar large SUV, you may want to consider the public parking down the street. Another minor complaint was the quality of the linens and towels. Both were older and need replaced. They weren't unusable, just cheap feeling. The mattress and pillows were excellent, however. As the old adage says - you get what you pay for. If you require 800 thread count bedding, pay $300/night at the Hyatt Regency. If you want clean, sufficient rooms with an unbeatable location for the price, head to the Primrose.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was the worst I've ever experience within the service industry. It is obvious that Customer Service is not a priority for this hotel. All they want is money. The front desk is rude and inexperienced. Being from out of town, we drove to Toronto to spend a nice week-end. The first impression we got from the Primrose Best Western was rudeness. Before checking in, they rudely told us that the parking space we had requested had been given to someone else and that we were to go down the street to public parking lot. THEY GAVE US WRONG DIRECTIONS. When we tried to call them asking for clarification as they had given us wrong directions, the women on the phone began yelling at us, denying that they gave us wrong directions and continuously transferred our call. It took 10 minutes before another hotel representative came on to give us proper directions. We were lost in a city we HAD never been in for 10 mintues during the night. Then came the room. We specficially asked for a king size bed with no kitchenette. When we got to our room, we got 2 separate beds and a kitchentte. What made it worse was we asked for a non-smoking floor and throughout the whole week-end all we could smell was cigarette smoke. They NEVER once apologized for their mix-ups and behaviours. I cannot begin to explain how awful this hotel is. It may be cheaper than other hotels, but the abuse you experience is not worth it. In my entire life, I have never been treated in such a rude, disrespecting manner. I would not reccomend this place to even my worst ennemies.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: runchadrun
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel unless you like slow (and possibly unsafe) elevators, flaky wireless Internet, and poor customer service. The elevators are extremely slow, sometimes taking 5 minutes just to get an elevator if you are on an upper floor. And if that elevator is full then good luck waiting for another. It shouldn't be too bad if you're on a lower floor and you like taking the stairs. You might also get stuck in the elevator, though the manager said that it happens all the time. And if you're lucky the alarm button in the elevator will have been fixed by then. The wireless Internet, while free, is not even worth that price. It was built using cheap consumer-grade access points instead of business grade ones that are more reliable and can be centrally managed. You'll get on for a couple minutes and then it will flake out and you'll spend the next 10 minutes trying to reconnect. The manager, Jeff, needs to learn a thing or two about customer service. When I complained about the elevators and wireless he just stood there with no apology or good explanation other than it would be too expensive to fix the elevators and it was all the guests' fault anyway for the elevator getting stuck since there were 8 people in the elevator (it's rated for 12 people). And when Rowena at the front desk gave us the wrong room (a double room instead of the king we had reserved 6 months before) the first thing she said when we immediately came back down was "did you take anything out of the room?" as if we were going steal the shampoo bottles. She kept asking us this for some reason and changed us to a king room without even an apology for the wrong room. You should also be aware that there are no fire sprinklers in the guest areas of the hotel. This is especially important now that they are installing kitchenettes in some of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel/Bad Service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to stay at this hotel for two nights because the price was so good. The hotel was dirty. The shower was disgusting and there were marks all over the walls and carpet. The hallways were also very dim and can be scary at night. The elevators took forever! Be prepared to wait at least five minutes, and the doors sensors do not work, which was very annoying. The staff treatment was alright. They weren't that friendly. I had called down to front desk to ask for some extra towels and they were giving me a hard time. We had also asked the concierge for directions to certain areas in Toronto and he wasn't helpful. I guess this hotel would be ok for people who are looking to party. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice weekend getaway or a family looking for a vacation. Spend the extra money and stay somewhere clean with friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury property, but well-run and comfortable for the price...”
Reviews.Author: exmontrealer
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this place four stars not for luxury, but for value. For the price, it's one of the better deals in Toronto. Check-in was courteous and quick. My non-smoking room was clean. I was surprised by touches here that even big hotels overlook; there were free newspapers in the lobby every morning, my room came with a small kitchenette and fridge, and - most importantly - the hotel offers free wi-fi access, rather than charge $10 or more per day like some places. On the downside: The fixtures and linens could use some updating, but everything was neat and well-maintained. If you're looking to get pampered, this probably isn't the place. But as a bargain, it's hard to beat in this very central part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Western”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel right in the Downtown core. Clean Environment. Helpful staff at the Front Desk and a good reception. Great Rooms. Probably the "BEST" Best Western I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Awful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am usually very generous in my reviews, but this place stinks. I'm not just talking about the smell either. Its located by Torontos most seedy street. Drugs and prostitutes there. The staff is not helpful and quite abrupt. I guess they have to deal with a lot of problems in this area they are always on edge. The rooms are incredibly shabby, the shower is the worst I've every used, the streams went in every direction but down. I was supposed to get a suite with a kitchenette and didn't get either. It is noisy at night with all the college kids. Overall, find a better hotel - 2 or 1 stars would be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: global traveller number one
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after speaking to a friend who knew it. Afterwards I read some reviews which were very mixed, but it was too late to cancel. As it was for only one night, I was not too worried. I discovered that I had nothing to worry about at all. For a downtown hotel at the rate we got, it was great. The room was large and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. I really think that when you write reviews, you have to take into account what you paid. Believe me, I am VERY critical, and for me to say that I had no complaints is a rarity. Go ahead, book it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: ShortName
Reviews.Content: Too expensive for the poor enviroment. The walls are chipped, and the elevators are terrible. There may be four of them, but they move slowly, and if you're in the lobby, be prepared to wait over five minutes for one to finally come down to you. The cleaning staff may be annoyed at you if you stay in your room all the day so they have no time to clean, and the ice machine says to 'PUSH DOWN', but does not tell what to push down on. Basically, don't stay here. Find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap for Downtown Fun”
Reviews.Author: jabroni79
Reviews.Content: The Primrose is a good hotel for people who plan on staying just a few dates in Toronto and plan on only sleeping there. I stayed there for one night with three friends. It was in a good location on Carlton/College Ave. It was only a few blocks east of Yonge St. The hotel parking was a little expensive (CAN $15) and the garage is compact so I would be careful if you drive a big car or SUV. The room are clean. The bathroom needed a little work but it was good enough for my needs. The non-free continental breakfast is a joke. I would just find breakfast somewhere else. In all, I would stay there again if I plan on going to Toronto to have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wound up staying at this hotel by mistake (my wife booked the wrong hotel online). Was a little worried given that it wasn't one of the higher end chains, but we were pleasantly surprised. Staff was extra friendly, room was large and clean, had a great view of the city and we were walking distance to just about everything. It's not a highend hotel, but it's great value for the price. Stan.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel, simple as. It would have looked dated, tacky and dirty in the 1900s. We specifically booked a non smoking room, but arrived to a foul smelling ash tray of a room, no air con, no openable windows. The TV had no sound, and the shower was abismal. The hotel looked full of facilities when booking, pool, sauna, exercise room, bar and restaurant. The pool was bath sized, so full of chemicals you could not see the bottom. The exercise room was closed, and I'd rather not eat than go to the ''restaurant'' / ''bar''. a one star rating for this hotel is far too generous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on-line for this hotel, which I suggest you do as well. The hotel is decent. The rooms are pretty big, views are nice and the hotel is quiet. The location is excellent. You can walk to everything since it is right downtown. It is a GREAT value and we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay in. Service was great. Friendly staff. Amazing Skyline view of Toronto!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Primrose Hotel Toronto Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 111 Carlton Street, Toronto, Ontario M5B 2G3, Canada
